bi3GbShky29kFCVmmteQuA.text: I really liked this place. We went in one night not knowing they closed in ten minutes. Sorry guys! They were so nice and didn't even mention the time to us. We did take everything to go although they offered us to sit inside. Kudos for the niceness.  I had an Italian beef sandwich with the dip on the side. Also got the foot long chili cheese dog.  The food was made fresh and hot.  I really enjoyed the chili cheese dog. It had onions which made the dog for me. It wasn't overly salty.  The Italian beef was a bit disappointing for me. Not that it was bad it just wasn't OMG I need to come back soon for this- good.  You know when you see things on tv and people make it look SOO good?! When you finally try it it is either wow this is so good! Or wow those people's tastes buds may not be as good as mine. Well I felt like I could live without Italian beef sandwiches. It was good but nothing I'd be recommending soon. I would recommend the chili cheese foot long though.  They had one with an Italian sausage I probably should have gotten.   The prices were affordable, the food was fresh and good, and the place was clean. With the friendly staff I'd definitely say check it out.

RmaaCpYGjKSlQbuB2RbHQw.text: Windy City Beefs-n-Dogs is so good. I love going here after I have my workout. Ha- I know that sounds CRAZY. I only do it once in a while. qX6cPTKX3pcdGqzJaZcP-Q.text: Love this place!  My husband is from Chicago and every time we go up there always have to get my fill of Italian Beef.  Love the beef and sausage combo dipped.  Just wish they did the Midwest style crinkle fries.  Have never had anything that we did not like and the staff is super friendly.

rrl7YOoWEuY6rOdtKLvYkw.text: I had never heard of Chicago-style Italian beef until I moved into an apartment a couple of blocks away from Al's Beef. I looked up reviews on yelp and things didn't look promising, so I held off going. But one night I was watching one of Anthony Bourdain's shows and he went to Chicago and had an Italian Beef. It looked so good I had to have one. I drove to Al's and ordered a hot beef dipped. The place felt like a fast-food restaurant, but I really wanted this sandwich to be good enough. I got the sandwich home, unwrapped it and took a bite...   Bland.   How was the meat so dry? I just watched them pull it out of a vat of warm liquid. It felt like I was eating mushy sandpaper.   So much disappointment.   This set me on a quest for a good Italian Beef in Vegas, and luckily I found Windy City Beefs-n'Dogs.   I walked in, and it's the total opposite of Al's. The people are friendly, and memorabilia lines the walls. You can feel that the people who run this place love it, and in a world of chains, it feels like a real family establishment.   I ordered the #13 beef and sausage, and was surprised to find that the sausage was actually in the beef. I fished it out, put it to the side, and took a bite of the Italian beef.   It was everything that Al's wasn't. Moist, fatty, and salty - the vinegar from the peppers cutting through it all combining to a delicious, perfectly balanced mess. The fries perfectly crisp. The meal is so large I can't finish it all at once, but I'm barely out the door before I start to crave it again. I've been there four times in the last two weeks. As an added bonus - the people here are unbelievably friendly.   This is no high-end restaurant, and the food is by no means fancy. But the price is right, the food is delicious, the people are friendly, and it's just everything you could possibly want it to be.

46UmNEMtbrb7lR7zqZgAKQ.text: I am new to Las Vegas and just found this place. I will now be here at least once a week!   It's great when you leave Chicago and find great food and Chicago spots in your new city.   The staff is very friendly and attentive. The food is exactly how you'd want it to taste, DA-LICIOUS!   The prices are excellent, not expensive at all.   This place is very small, it's in the big shopping plaza off Lake Mead. There are only a few small TV's, so you can't go here for a good sports watching day. But...it more than makes up for with the quality of food and staff! They have lots of Chicago sports memorabilia on the walls inside, which is a huge plus! Represent!

We got them dipped in the au jus which kept the sandwich warm and added a savory taste  Worth a trip out here.

Db5_5pM6u3gANDW70cy7uA.text: Really good stuff here. Great dogs and sandwiches. The peppers and relish are legit. A must for those that crave a "Chicago Dog", my favorite.  A lot of Chicago memorabilia.

UlIOJq_K5_PR4Fr9VOu4rw.text: My family is from Chicago so having Windy City Beefs n Dogs is a big deal.  They have good Chicago hotdogs and Italian beef sandwich.  Their combos are pretty good and they also serve burgers, Polish sausage, chicken wings/fingers, corned beef, gyro and pizza puff in one small place.  They have TV's on sports channels, a bar and some small tables inside.  There's outdoor seating too.  On the Italian beef sandwich, you have 3 options: dry, wet or dipped.  Dry - juicy but no juices dripping.  Wet - you can eat with or without a fork and knife, it depends on whether or not you want juices on your clothes.  Dipped - so soggy and wet you have to eat with a fork and knife with lots of napkins.   My sister and I both ordered the #4: Chicago dog and a 3-inch Italian beef sandwich with fries.  My sister got a Chicago dog with everything on it and a spicy and wet Italian beef sandwich with everything on it as well.  I got a Chicago dog sans pickles and onions, and a mild and dipped Italian beef sandwich...so good!  The giardinera's perfect.  Definitely a taste of Chicago.

SBjYeRhE2pa7V79oa5HinA.text: Da dawgs!  If you live in Vegas, you already know you can visit Paris, the Big Apple or Italy with just a short drive to the Strip. So often, however, these Vegas versions leave much to be desired. Our Paris is packed with slot machines and plastic Eiffel Towers full of daiquiris; New York- New York is a watered down, corporate version of the real thing and apart from the gondolas, visiting the Venetian is about as exciting as a trip to Epcot Center, complete with bewildered herds of tourists. But step inside Windy City and bam! There you are in a downtown Chicago hot dog joint, complete with mouth-watering smells, packed with photos from Wrigley and Soldier Fields and staffed by the kind of smiling, friendly Midwestern folk who've made hundreds  of hot dog spots in the real windy city longtime tourist favorites. Like about 80 percent of Chicago vendors, Windy City sells Vienna Beef hot dogs, and the cooks here build 'em any way you want. I recommend you order yours Chicago style: in a warm, soft bun and piled high with tomato, onion, green relish, pickle, sport peppers, mustard and celery salt. (Also, it should be a crime NOT to try the chili-cheese fries.) Grab your dog and head back to any number of the tiny tables lining this narrow, in-love-with-Chicago hot dog heaven. Check out the wall photos of Walter Payton or the Chicago skyline. Lose yourself for a moment in a haze of beef, bun and that warm, world-famous Chicago family feeling. Unlike other themed hot dog spots in the valley, Windy City offers a superior product at a reasonable price, is meticulously clean and actually feels and sounds (thanks to its funny, outgoing staff) like its namesake.  Las Vegas and Chicago: two cities joined at the hot dog (to paraphrase a favorite writer of mine).

dvIzHSjahFFbGY5hNDtgJg.text: Sandwich was great and extremely satisfying. The service was great and these people look and act like they are from chicago (thats a good thing). I felt like I was being transported from vegas to chicago the moment i entered the shop.

5RYx_U2O4BwcTiPA40DUjA.text: My wife is in love with all things Chicago so I decided to try Windy City Beefs-N-Dogs and was pleasantly suprised.  Windy City Beefs-N-Dogs has its strong points and its weak points.  One thing I do like about this restaraunt is that they use very high quality ingredients.  I had a beef and sausage sandwich and the beef was fresh and juicy and the sausage was huge (no dinky small sausage around here).  I also liked this relish like substance they put on their sandwich, which is a combination of carrots, peppers, and onions.  The Au Jus was delicious.    One thing I would say though is this is not a place to go if you are trying to monitor your cholestrol or even lose a few pounds.  Everything is greasy and fattening, but this is not necessarily a bad thing if it is done right (and in this case it is).  The only complaint I had about my sandwich is that it might use some more seasoning as it was slightly bland.  It is possible though this is a more stylistic attribute of the Chicago style food so I can't complain.  All in All Great place.

3Q3Wiv_eP1bha8OCDj7EUA.text: I was so excited to try this place after getting a couple glowing reviews from some native Chicagoans.   Walked in on a weekday around 4pm, and it wasn't too busy. Told the girl up front that it was our first time, and she took the time to explain the entire menu to us. Though it took some time, this was much appreciated.   She helped us decide on the #4, which is literally called the Best of Both Worlds. This came with a premium all-beef Chicago Dog (complete with steamed poppyseed bun), as well as a small Italian Beef Sandwich, and fries in a brown paper bag.  I got my Chicago dog the way it comes, for the full experience. The veggies were cold and crisp, the steamed bun was perfectly warm and soft, and the celery salt on top made it perfect. For the beef sandwich, I opted to add the mozzarella and the medium spicy giardinera mix (italian vegetable relish). Unfortunately I got more than halfway through before I realized that even though I had paid for it, the giardinera mix never made it on my sandwich. I did bring this to the cashier's attention, and she was very apologetic. She told me that next time I come in, they would take care of another sandwich for me. I thought this was extremely hospitable and professional. This is how you make things right and create a repeat customer.  Everything was so tasty, I never wanted it to end. Even without the spicy veggie mix, the sandwich was absolutely delicious.   Side Note: THE FRIES ALREADY COME CRISPY!! I love crispy fries so I ordered extra crispy (since I normally have to do this at other places to avoid soggy fries), and I think I ruined them. Should have left them as is. My fault.  Five stars. We'll be back very soon.

07ee-38AsHoABzWMfmi6eg.text: I gave the windy city a second chance again to be totally disappointed I ordered the special patty melt fries and a drink the burger was raw the hamburger patty was so small that after he made it and cut it in half I took two bites of the first half that I picked up after the two bites the rest was all bread picked up the second half thinking that maybe the meat was on the other side I took 3 bites the meat was gone and the rest was all bread I brought it to the attention of the cook and the girl behind the counter and her answer was that's how we do it is that how you do it there is that how you do it in Chicago very disappointing this is one place I will never come back to $9 for unsatisfying patty melt the soda was good

pQWrkCzAgA9kdkmHa7CRQw.text: I like Windy City a lot, I usually get the double sausage sandwich? At least I think that's what it's called haha. Their customer service is fantastic, and it feels very genuine. My only concern doesn't relate to the staff, but more towards ownership and management. I feel like they should point out what certain things on the menu mean. For example, you can get a hot dog "wet, dry, or dipped". I, and I'm sure a few other people have no idea what that means. Instead of requiring the cashiers to have to tell the customers what it means all the time, they should put it on the menu. It's a Chicago themed restaurant in Vegas, so that idea would only help. Overall though, great place to go for sausages or a hot dog!

0RCVFv6iB_XpcJma7i8sGw.text: Stumbled on this place while it here for work. It is delicious and tastes just like the Dogs did back in Chicago. The double play is a great value and hits he spot. Definitely worth visiting and eating here.  Great atmosphere too.

L3rS2DSOAuc4ChpgXVFxeA.text: I have been here several times for lunch and this place is packed during that time.  The floorplan is very narrow, so if you plan on eating in, be prepared to have folks standing by your table as they wait in line to place their order during the rush time.  Their man offerings is like the name, Beef N Dogs.  They have a variety of combos available that can get you dogs or beefs (or beefs and dogs) with fries.  I usually get a combo that gives a small beef (3 or 4" or so) and a chicago style hot dog.  When ordering, you can opt to have your au jus ladled on, dipped and double dipped.  There are also a variety of add-ons you can get such as giardiniera mix, cheese, etc - all at an extra cost, so be careful if you're tight on cash because these add on fast.  I have also heard that their wings are great but I have never personally tried them.  The guy in front of me ordered 23 wings one time and it's been bothering me since then about what a weird number of wings that was...hmmmm....anyway, I hope to try them soon and see for myself if they're tasty.  All of the food I have eaten is tasty consistently except for the fries - which are served in a brown paper bag on the side of your basket of whatever you ordered.  I like fries, but they have come crisp, soggy, etc.  - pretty inconsistently.  I wish there was an option to purchase the food without fries as I'm not that big of a fan of the fries, plus they are an additon that can put the amount of food intake over the top.   The staff has been nice, although we forgot to ask for au jus once and when our food came, asked for it on the side and got a slight ass-chewing for it being extra.  So next time we knew that we best not forget!  Being nice folks, they brought it of course, but weren't happy about it.  Overall, it's a great place for lunch and unfortunately, not too late at night as I have wanted to go there for some food later in the evening and they have already closed.  Thumbs up for super tasty food!

zHiJ6m1KX8sz7VJDCCfJ9A.text: I LOVE this place!! Always extremely fast service, even when busy. They always have the best costumer service and are so friendly! One of my favorite quick eats!

iBqHUS37dT8MWMdNHNLBjQ.text: My wife and I stopped by Windy City Beefs N Dogs on a Saturday afternoon outing based on our friend's recommendation. Not really knowing what to expect, we opened the door and were immediately greeted by the staff manning the grill.   We walked deeper into the "joint" decorated with Chicago memorabilia (mostly sports) and immediately became overwhelmed with Chicago delicacies on the menu that we knew nothing about (since we are not Chicagoans). Playing it safe, we went with the tried and True Chicago dogs. We each ordered the two dog combo which comes with fries and a drink. After ordering, we got our drinks at the self service fountain, sat down at a table and waited for the food to be prepared. Everything is made to order, so if you are patient, you are in for some great tasting food.   When our food was ready, they brought our wrapped dogs in a basket and piping hot fries in a little brown bag to our table. The dogs looked just like the picture and the flavors of the Chicago dog were amazing (Chicago pickle relish, sliced tomatoes, sporty peppers and celery salt - all of which are offered for sale at the counter).   My wife and I ate, all the while being checked on to see if everything was okay by the employees. We were so amazed by the flavor of these new found favorite hot dogs.   As we got up and headed for the exit, all the employees thanked us for coming in.   We now make special trips to Windy City just for their Chicago dogs.

NfIh_ko5fC8d_JJVCFtE3w.text: I honestly can't believe I've never posted a review for Windy City.  This is the real deal place for a beef dip in Las Vegas. It's that good!  Bar and restaurant owners in the Las Vegas Valley throw their hands up in frustration and scream,  "Damn you Windy City" when their hotdog bun stuffed full of processed roast beef and a side of "Ahhh Joo" gets sent back to the kitchen, because the secret is out... Real beef dips taste great.  The staff is super friendly.  The food is delicious.  The restaurant is clean.   I avoid Lake Mead and Buffalo, because I can't NOT,  double negative,  stop for a beef dip. Sue me!  I recommend to everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant
Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef dip, double hot, dipped!  Don&#39;t judge me!

rbVK18XeIa458vxMicdP9g.text: The girl cashier was rude tonight and took another customer before us on purpose.  I've been here before, but I've never before had such poor customer service.  The hot dogs and fries are decent but really nothing to write home about.  It's possible to get these kind of dogs at fast food joints, and the buns are kinda on the mushy/soggy side.  Being from the Midwest, I like the Chicago decor, but friendliness is an attribute to that area of the country, and this place fell short of that tonight.   I agree with others that there are no alternatives for turkey, veggie or vegan dogs which is why I could never bring any of my veg friends there.  Who wants to eat just fries?  Not a problem anymore since I won't be back.

8fGEL9R2zq5cUZWFKbs-1A.text: We tried the corned beef sandwich. I'm not the biggest fan of corned beef, but when I get a hankering for it, I need the real thing. The sandwich is pretty, with swirled pumpernickel bread and cheddar, but the corned beef appears to be the kind that comes in slices or a pack rather than the brisket we're used to. Plus, they fried the meat! We'll search some more for REAL corned beef.

sLt7WbC_WggFGDI-yqiARg.text: This place is great! Great food, great service and awesome menu... If u are looking for a good Chicago style place and haven't tried Windy City, I highly recommend u to try.

4s2MVR2YXHijXCLc7N04rQ.text: May have found one of my new favorite lunch spots. I remember trying it a few years ago and wasn't all that impressed. Being from the Chicago area and trying to find some good food I decided to give it another try and found that I enjoyed it much better. Hot dogs and sausage sandwiches are very tasty especially for the price. Is it 100% authentic like being in Chicago? No but it's one of the closest I have found in this town

eQOVNOA9-7ta_uAs0pS0Qw.text: I got the italian beef sandwich, dipped with sweet and hot peppers. Tender, messy and delicious! Great fries too! Staff was courteous and quick! Best sandwich in town!

FeBX0GVEuMrRsY-OPgwsNg.text: There is something just missing from this beef sandwich. I cant place my finger on it. It wasnt bad at all but its missing something. I had the beef sandwich wet, with cheese and peppers just how i get it at al's and its short.

bgRlU2_Yw5FK5_8KN2smVQ.text: From Chicago.....craving a pizza puff and fries, maxwell street polish, vienna beef sand???  This is the place to go....Super friendly staff who go out of their way to make you feel like your back home.  Had my fiance try a juicy vienna beef sand with mozzarella and sweet peppers (as only a True chicagoan can order) he was hooked from the first bite. I had my fix of a pizza puff, left out with a big smile. Everything was great... They offer daily specials like free dog if your wearing a cubs jersey, etc. Support a Chicago business and give them a try, I know you won't be disappointed..

FtYfRhbgn4xkytArw7OkYQ.text: Great people, great Food. I love the soft Poppy Seed buns and they made a great Chi dog.

R8L_8xM287GWgNVxuYwtFg.text: Great Lil place especially if your a fan of good food from chicago. Staff was very welcoming and friendly and provide great service. The place was very clean. Kid friendly and all of the food was so so good. Highly recommend for a quick bite to eat.

r9hgOg1i16GOXyljjBqUKw.text: Yummy food!  Love .50 cent chicken wing Tuesdays! Also their chili cheese fries are delicious ! Super friendly staff! Convenient location as well.

UUPJadXRxESVkgMoSVNlxg.text: I've been here several times, and have tried something different each time. Here's what I liked and didn't like:  Really Liked: - Polish Sausage: crisp, meaty, tasty, and filling - Giardiniera: good flavor and a very nice kick - Gyro: the meat is juicy, and the fresh made tzatziki is excellent  Liked: - Hot dogs: pretty good, but I've had better Chicago dogs; nothing that especially stands out  On the Fence: - Italian beef: maybe it's just the one I had, but it was oddly bland - Fries: a little too hard, a little too salty  Didn't Like: - Pizza puff: kind of a greasy mess  Overall, though, the food there I like outweighs the food I'm neutral towards or don't like. The folks there are also very friendly and they always have ESPN on at least one screen, which is a plus for me. I definitely recommend WCBND, especially their polish sausage and gyro.

6bxAiXSb2hmjmcOg8RGQYw.text: I can't believe I have shopped at Von's dozens of times and never investigated Windy City.  I only found it by using Yelp's nearby function, but now that I have, I will be back.  I tried their Italian Beef sandwich, wet, with mozzarella and giardiniera.  The beef was super tender and they get a bonus point for having above-average fries!  The staff was friendly and the other food looked great.

Jzth7F_mJIpuCn_VzgjvUg.text: Being from Chicago, this place is just the comfort food I'm looking for when I'm homesick. Beef is actually really good. The only thing they REALLY need is liquid cheese for cheese fries. If they had Merkts cheddar I would give it 5 stars.

zZtiXfw4_PQp8x8NLQ940w.text: I've been to Chicago and had their infamous deep dish pizza, and I have to say that their deep dish takes you back to that very first delicious bite. If I ever need to have my deep dish fill, I'll make sure to stop by this place whenever I'm in town visiting!

Gz-0tCyGafXr8-tOLAFunA.text: What an absolutely fun place with great food. Nothing like it in Vegas really. We had the chili cheese dog and the hot dog plus beef sandwich meals. They tasted perfect!  I would highly recommend this place to anyone who loves this type of food. Worth the drive, although I wish I lived a little closer.

cWDmDYrh_Nw-jXzgeH4QWA.text: I've had the tamales with chili and they are awesome my favorite dish hands down. Theres always a line so it's gotta be good

eED8kPItQbjKgXSoB5PjEg.text: Yaaaay! I did not drive across town in vain! This place is a keeper! Had the chicago dog with everything and the Italian  beef wet with gardiner ( I don't know how to spell that) and fries, everything was great.

HQIst3YBZeBzn4tY0jtJNA.text: Reminds me so much of back home in Chicago. The have the best Chicago style food in Vegas. The restaurant is really nice inside. The staff is nice. I was in the area the other day and had to go in even tho I just had a bite. Cause I knew I would want some later.

7jv6Td9pT6PgM049D0UBvw.text: Nice little place with really tasty hot dogs! The food was very good, I enjoyed their Chicago style dogs but they also have sandwiches and chicken fingers, among other things. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Really relaxed atmosphere with Chicago sports memorabilia for decor. Great place for lunch or a quick laid back dinner.

ZuinH-OZo57BivJiDnRHSA.text: Props to this little lunch joint. Any place that can deliver a fast and filling and good lunch for under $10 gets 5 stars in my book. Hits all the marks with the food but the clean and friendly service to boot. I will be back.

GZWyNh_M0pMutO5uLEC8ww.text: Really tasty and fresh. Great meat with yummy toppings. I have ordered #2, 22, 3, and the 13. My family was happy with the choices and commented how good they tasted.  The fries are a bonus - so filling. The Green River soda and their specialty  chips are new to this West Coast girl. Thank you Windy City for bringing Chicago to Las Vegas.

h-QZpePgmHFBnizOELJIkQ.text: Windy City Beef N Dogs. Best Hot Dog in Las Vegas. If you are from Chicago like me, think Superdawg or Byrons. Also excellent Italian Beef Sandwich. You can get it dry, dipped or wet. Think Al's in Chicago. Order at the counter and grab a table. Your order will be deliverd to the table by the friendly staff. Great service, indoor or outdoor seating. Worth a drive from anywhere.  For us they have replaced another place on Rancho that serves Chicago style Hot Dogs.

gbaCMqxSlXXu2oF4OxUQlg.text: Just got accused of stealing soda? The manager (assuming she was) came to our table and said "I'm sorry. I have to charge you guys for your drinks. She (her cashier) said she gave you guys water cups and it's not fair for my other customer who have to pay for drinks." She handed us 2 receipts. My friend lifted the coke bottle and said, "you mean this?". The manager said "oh you guys are ok." The manager didn't even apologize. Our drink was paid for when we bought our meal.

cppB4Z9zGlYUbTfCKlFrNg.text: It's weird to say but that was by far the best hot dog I've ever eaten. We had the Italian beef & a hamburger also but that hot dog....I almost bit my husbands finger to get another bite!!

In5x1LeR1OPtj-vSwwP35w.text: My husband went with coworkers for lunch and he enjoyed the hot dogs so much that he took me there. Now he and I frequent t the place regularly and we love it. It's way friendly, cozy, clean and most of all delicious. I thought it was only a hot dog joint, uh uh, they serve Gyros,(which I eat every time)cheeseburgers,chicken wings, well you get it.  Awesome! Prices are reasonable and the staff greet you on the way in and out. Fantastic atmosphere! A+

eLqA5nwh2yGpTBid4ZzJHg.text: Las Vegas is a far cry from Chicago and if you ever been to Chicago you know that Vienna Beef Hot Dogs made the Chicago way or style are outstanding.  Windy City brings that bit of Chicago here to Las Vegas.  if you long for Chicago style Hot Dogs this has what you want.  The place is decorated with everything from Chi Town...the Cubbies, the White Sox and the Stanley Cup Champs The Black Hawks.....this place is a homer.

Y_54XekirkhpCLydsMS7tQ.text: I'm from northern Illinois, and know a thing or two about Chicago style beefs, sausage, and dogs.  This is THE best place for that in Las Vegas.  Highly recommend it!

mkISW8wZPMm-T2YntsIc9Q.text: This place gets a solid 4 stars for many reasons.  One being the closest to a real Chicago dog from real Chicago peeps I have had outside of Chicago.    The firm but soft bun, the snap of a great dog (however I did not get the vienna dog I hear those are better) the mustard on the dog, the oh so sweet relish that for some reason you cannot find but online, the oh so snappy pickle, the crisp firm onions and the firm pickled spicy sport peppers, oh and don't forget the special salt.  An all and all great Chicago dog!  Oh and a Bag of fries, gotta like that one ;)  However I almost got slightly distracted from my goal and got the Ruben a favorite of mine that I rarely order.  Ok next time...  So the solid 4 stars come from the owners working behind the cook bar, and the fact that they came by twice not just for me but others as well to see how the food was.  The wife-owner also came by to take baskets away (take baskets away at a fast food spot?! AWESOME!)  and make sure you were full.  While we were there a steady stream of people came and went.  I found out they used to have a spot downtown that was recently closed down due to downtown building improvements.    I don't remember people being this friendly in Chicago but I do remember a time when people were this friendly in general.  It was an awesome change as far as treatment goes and I love a small business run how it should be run by people who care.

uuswfPrqqm1_J8VK1aTsCA.text: Moved to Vegas from Chicago and tried "Chicago" eateries and never found the right until I found Windy City.  I go to Eastern location cause I love Tina and staff.  Best Italian beef and pizza and hot dogs.

vi_Zopu3U6qjhurqenTtmQ.text: The wings are super yummy nice and crispy and they go great with there chili cheese fries yum

RadohSZAFYJWYdRp1tn-ug.text: This place has THE BEST Chicago hot dogs in town. Fast service and very friendly staff. Enjoyable place to eat. Highly recommend Windy City!

zTNmjLgo_h_SSrRthUxM7w.text: It's a small place, but with a very friendly staff. They seem to know the names of a lot of the customers, which is always a good sign to me.  I am completely in love with Italian beef/sausage sandwiches, and I have yet to find anything to compare to what I get in Chicago. But, this is definitely the place to go to for these sandwiches in Vegas. If you go on Wednesdays, it's 'Windy City Wednesdays' which means you get a free drink and order of fries if you get the Combo Sandwich. The sausage is a little peppery and nicely grilled, while the Italian Beef is tender and juicy. You can get the sandwiches either dry, wet, or dipped.   I also tried their pizza puffs. Never had one before so I didn't know what to expect. But, what I did get was delicious. As good as it was though, it makes me feel super guilty eating it because the amount of calories it must have.   This definitely isn't the place to go to, if you're looking to trim down. But, they have good food at decent prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo.

zdytf3k6jfLkDaHr99yLuQ.text: Service was great, had a nice welcoming feeling when we stepped in. The hot dogs and fries were good and we had the wings with the Chicago hot sauce. We recommend the wings, hot sauce with a side of ranch. Taste really good with the fries. My fiance and I will be back next week.

zIKtBrSttvx7pAyN2_DhNA.text: The food is good as long as u like Chgo food. Prices are high.. The young staff are friendly & the orders are always correct but the 2 Lady owners (sisters) are RUDE RUDE RUDE!!!!  I don't like their treatment towards their customers. You can SAVE money & shop @ Glaziers. Same Vienna hotdogs, beefs & Supreme Hot Tamales for 1/2 the price..

B3w7YBNYy3O-iILjrF4YcQ.text: Always a pleasure going here. People are super friendly and food is good. Definitely a fun place to go on game day.

ALQpcqdkTjkbGT-wrGE9lQ.text: I had been wanting to give this place a try for sometime now. The location on Eastern is 5 star all the way, but the same vibe isn't felt at this location for me. The menu board above the register is painful to look at because it's awkwardly hanging. The employees were very friendly and helpful with going over the menu and checking on us while eating. I ordered a "Pizza Puff" combo priced at $4.50 plus 50 cents each for the addition of chili and cheese to the fries, onions were free. The pizza puff had cheese, sausage and sauce inside. It did taste ok. It reminded me of something you got for school lunch when you were younger, but in a very slightly better way. The basket of chili cheese fries is over $4 alone, so upgrading your combo with the addition of chili and cheese for just a buck makes it cheaper for the same size. The fries were good and the onions very fresh. The chili was not god though. I have had canned chili that tasted better. The basket of fries was a huge amount, but I really didn't eat but a few bites and then just couldn't eat anymore so a lot was wasted. I'd give the food here a 2 star rating alone, but I'm factoring service and cleanliness inside, so 3 stars seems fair. They do have some seating outside with umbrellas on the tables for shade. There is a bar with maybe 6-ish stools to sit at or you can sit at a table, but the tables are small (most seat 2 people) and if you get stuck sitting along the back hall area it can feel cramped. Currently on Tuesdays they offer wings for 50 cents each.

Mj74_C_q6CCXiqqOZjEMEQ.text: I've eaten at the other location in Henderson and really liked it. They also have good deep dish pizza at the other location however the the only pizza you will find at this one is a puff since the menu mostly consists of dogs, sausages, Italian beef and wings. I had a #12 which is a 2 grilled sausages with onions and peppers on bread. The onions and peppers were perfect but the sausage was too dry. Remember I had not just 1 but 2 of these dry sausage to work through. Even with adding mustard it just didn't help. Then my wife and I shared a basket of chili cheese fries however we didn't eat but a small dent in them. After tasting the chili I remembered that I didn't like it at the other location either. Honestly I don't care that it doesn't have beans but what I care more about is that it tastes like a stinky armpit smells. I love chili just not here. My wife ordered a pizza puff that I ended up eating a few bites of and it surprised me how much I liked it. I have had more authentic ones at other places and this one is more like a over-sized totinos pizza roll yet it was damn good. I can't say enough about how nice the staff was. They took the time to show us menus we could read at a table since the menu board here is curved and at a weird angle so you need a neck massage after looking at it too long. Staff checked on us a couple times to make sure we were good and to see if we needed anything so that was a plus. The inside is small with some tables and a bar with stools and they have a couple tables outside.

lbIMP8Odv8k6XOM-Yf33EQ.text: I went here just for the Italian beef.  This place is easy to order from and I liked the service from the friendly staff. Apparently the place had a deal that if your name is mike you get a free hot dog....nice.    The Italian beef came out dripping through the paper and it was awesome. Great flavor and exactly what I wanted.   The hot dog was authentic and yes had the snap.   I will return again soon...

xTUCbYILfshmV5rD8aouxg.text: Extremely close to a panic Chicago cuisine. But the Italian beef's are outstanding delicious right on point. Another hidden gem in Las Vegas that more people should visit. The staff is also very friendly.

nSpc7MN0xD8FG7QOIgpUBA.text: First time here. We were greater at the door. Very friendly staff and amazing Chicago dogs.  We got a free one for casino employee day! The prices are definitely affordable. We sat outside nice set up. Can't wait to become a regular here.

faIcoOrOdf8QWxefEGxHEw.text: We drove out of our way to try this place after a friend told us about it. The Italian beef was amazing! My kiddo had the footling chili dog! Super messy (the way it should be) and delicious! Very nice staff! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars.... Both me & my husband asked for the dip on the side-they dipped his & left mine dry but didn't give me any of the au jus. The girl at the register asked me which giardinera I wanted (if any) & since it was our first time there offered me a sample of the ones they had. I never got the samples & they put the mild one on my sandwich. We did not complain, the food was good-just giving my reason for the 4 stars.

_1nE0qGPEnnjTutMSvZkAw.text: This place was great. I ordered a to-go order and hung out at the long counter while it was made and it was a cool little place. Reminded me of places I e been to in Chicago. I've noticed that places that have memorabilia on all the walls tend to get dusty and dingy over time because the stuff on the walls is never cleaned; this was not the case at Windy City Dogs. The whole restaurant was very clean and all the employees were very friendly. Will definitely go again.

QqiertLahjS7GZ1MIU-gMQ.text: 5 stars. I actually want to give them less only because they are so far from my house! Why isn't there anything nice in the South West part of town? If they were in the South West, I'd be bankrupt from eating there 24/7/365.  The most authentic Chicago Beef sandwich in Las Vegas. I get the #10 (Chicago Beef) DIPPED with extra of the hot giardiniera. It comes so wet I need to take a bath afterward, and I wouldn't have it any other way! The beef a jus is delicious (that's why you get it dipped!). Sure it starts to disintegrate quickly, just eat it faster! I used a fork to continuously scrap up the hot giardiniera with every bite. It's almost sad when you have to take that last bite. I'd get a second one to take home but I live like 15 miles away. The sandwich would never last dipped on that journey.  Besides the Chicago Beef the Chicago dogs are great. Again, super authentic. And to top it all off the staff is beyond friendly. They constantly ask you how everything is and if you need anything.  That's not just one employee, but all of them!  Like a said the only real bummer is that there isn't more of these around the city. If I ever hit I big, maybe I can see if they would let me open up another location on the South West side?! One can dream can't they?!?

7OFX6Mk0BvX3j9ohkBiGcw.text: I'm not a Chicagon, but went to college in Chicago and fell in love with the city ever since. This place is definitely my go to place when I need a bite of Chicago. A must try! Hopefully they open a more centrally located branch because I'll definitely become a regular.

bqrQ4r9AthtSAxmwHtLLTg.text: Very impressive hot dogs and beef sandwiches Chicago-style.  Reasonable prices and good service.  Nice portions and specials.  Good french fries too.  Like their poppy seed hot dog buns.  Like the decor and ambiance.  Not health food but quality food nevertheless.

ugOIonYcEvi8vLQWrxoMDg.text: It's a taste of Chicago right here in Vegas. Hands down great service and food.  Everything on the menu is delicious.

buTES_j3A56IMY9MbL0jAQ.text: Been coming here since opening and still awesome Italian beef ,wings and burgers. Need one up north by my house

n1rN2L2ZYxy3te0rzHY7bQ.text: I cannot brag about this place enough! All the food is delicious and the staff is so amazingly nice! My dad is from Chicago and this place reminds him of home. I don't know who decided to make this place, but they're the real MVP! Everything here is delicious and just amazing! GO BEARS!

OPJsCwN-RS85zEXCV4l6iA.text: Italian beef was amazing just like Chicago's.  Hot dog was super bland no flavor but the chili was outstanding. Friendly staff.

rXNWygtpN_JZGIEAvBZe5w.text: I have been your twice now with my family and the food is delicious! The menu is simple but they have great selection of hot dogs! They make the fries fresh when you order them. their staff is very friendly and service oriented.

L7H9IEk-sLk37mo_5CFD0g.text: I give the 4th star because this place was run by a younger generation. there were 4 there from wat I could see and everyone was pleasant not to mention their food was good. i had the chili cheese fries and my man had the chili dog.

msLXmbAffNbQDwrvawWk7Q.text: When i came here i was really craving a hot dog IDK WHY!!! but honestly for a place that SPECIALIZES in hot dogs it wasnt all that great. THE FRIES were the best part.

fLGrw2xh2AW7IZtzMQK33g.text: Excellent food and service.  Very reasonably priced. Large menu variety.  Plenty of parking but limited tables.

oz2UqiYWDhjhXTiQvEqm3g.text: Great customer service. They know my husband when we come in for lunch. Everyday my husband is here eating lunch it teminds us of home The Windy City ( Chicago).

6s24fYP6wsPcrNJiHgF0RQ.text: We love this place. They've got a very nice menu with a number of options to choose from and everything is cooked right there while you wait. My husband always orders the Double Play-- two Chicago-style hotdogs with fries, and my daughter really likes their chicken fingers and fries. I've found that the food is of very good quality, the prices are fair, and the staff is always friendly. And...the place is clean. Definitely worth a visit if you're craving something tasty.

oPALM498m6wIqyMfwJujWw.text: Omg! It was delicious, amazing incredible i can't  belive i been in Vegas for almost 30 yrs and i have never  heard of this place before. I will be back for more. I had the #5 something about polish sausage spicy with caramelized onions and fries.

XBhmvuoFxt8IacHyMr9P5Q.text: The food is great and you are treated like family.  I cannot say enough good about this place.

fYD-0awp2fkN98Mf1ljWjQ.text: Staff are friendly and they even hook the kids up with free ice cream at the end! How thoughtful! This review is coming rather late and I seriously thought I typed one on. Apparently not because here I am.  I am by far the most dantiest hotdog eater, ever. I can go years without putting a hotdog in my mouth...cue in long blink...lol. stay focus, stay focus...  The husband is the only reason why we even came here to begin with. He has a co-worker who is from Chicago and says this place is the real deal. Well, if you're like me and don't even know what that really means...apparently, it is. They serve the Vienna brand and I still don't know what that means. All I know is the taste and smell of vienna sausage from a can makes me puke and that's how I associate vienna. So brave me who is trying to get my taste buds out the norm...opt for the Chicago dog.   If you do not know, you're going to want to because it is absolutely delicious. For someone like me who prefers just ketchup and onions on my hotdog whenever I do...the Chicago dog gave me a new appreciation. The hotdog had a snap to it that I do expect of a hotdog. I don't know if it's because it's vienna, I didn't particularly like the flavor of the dog itself...but add in the sport peppers, relish, mustard, tomatoes, celery salt, a soft poppy seed bun and all that other jazz...i was able to overlook it. You can't help but to look around and ask for another one! It was deelish! It comes with pickled Spears as well but I can't stand pickles and relish is as far as I can handle. I don't even like mustard but I decided to not omit so I can get as True to the experience as possible.  My Chicago dog was 5 bucks with fries! Hoody hoo! Husband got some Italian sausage something something...I didn't keep track. I had 4 other heads whose order I had to keep in mind. All I know was he was in big boy heaven. His cost about 7 bucks I believe as his was a sandwich rather than a hot dog.   In conclusion, I believe this place is worth every penny. Everything was made to order and everything tasted very fresh. We are in the area weekly and I know my husband is going to want to come by for his fix...he had one yesterday but I had him try out a different hotdog spot. It's really nice too because customers were coming in and just talking up a storm like you'd see at diners who are clearly frequent customers. So that makes it feel pretty homely.  Highly recommend if you are in a hotdog mood and you got more spare to change so that a hotdog fix doesn't consist of a trip to your local wholesale warehouse. =P

3uF3fYAHYcU0wvXadAS4ag.text: Heard some good things about this place so this past Sunday we were driving by and noticed it, and stopped in.  It was about 10 minutes before closing time.  I placed my order and it was ready in about 10 minutes, just as they were closing the doors.  The Chicago dogs were flimsy -  I think they had put most of the condiments away and this was the remnants and I asked for sauerkraut also -  about 1 tablespoon on top.  It was all pressed into the bun not appetizing at all.  Also got a chili dog -- the chili was just poured on to the point that the bun was a soggy mess.  Lastly the fries that were part of the meal were also the remnants from the fry tray -  the bag that they supply was not even half full.  I won't be back.

MzKe7ytvJkVHRB5bORx6PQ.text: The food was delicious here!! We ordered a chili cheese fries, Reuben, cheese burger, and chicken fingers. The fries are given to you in a paper bag. The place is very welcoming, you can sit bar side and watch them cook up your order. We placed our order over the phone, when we arrived it was not ready. However they jumped on the order were extremely apologetic and honestly after tasting the food I still decided to give them 5 stars!!

ITp00xPdhxGr5LZj3k85Tg.text: First time here and I am amazed! We sat at the bar and it overlooks their kitchen so we watched how they made our orders. I swear, I was excited for my food! I ordered the #3 windy city's foot long Vienna chili cheese dog and fries! It exceeded my expectations! Definitely check this place out!

9O5cYx7gVu3F8aA2shzADA.text: I have to give Pete a shout out for reviewing this place. I haven't had a pizza puff in years.  We havent found a goodChicago style restaurant here in Vegas. We use to go to another place which I won't name, but  stopped going after my husband and I both got food poisoning. Although nothing here is good for my diet, it's a nice treat.

3RNKm6nipwlhfvn_hS-r1w.text: Gerat Beefs great dogs and amazing decor! I will go back to this location every time I find my self in Las Vegas. Two things you must see the Las Vegas strip at night and this Italian beef at the south end of the stop must do

mux4K7nG5idxm49a_JRwpQ.text: Have been here a few times, always forgetting to review them.,,,anyhoo...I always get the chigago beef sandwich...dipped,   what a mess of yumminess, the other half gets the beef and sausage combo sandwich, au jus on the side...I don't get that but he likes it that way.  They also have good hotdogs which I tried because my name was on the get one free board if Monique is your name...yeah for me.  we try to hit this place up at least once or twice a month..anymore and i'd 50 billion pounds overweight.  :)

T7aWlqbXXSOTbwPgymLPxw.text: Service was Terrible, the girl at the cashier was rude we left, before we even ordered.

cR6y7ynwphq7iHU1G9VXKw.text: We threw a party for 30 to celebrate Independence Day and ordered from Windy City's bulk menu to provide Italian beef for the hungry crowd. We picked up the fixings (beef, au jus, bread, peppers and giardinera) a few hours before the party and it was a breeze to prep and serve. It was a big hit. Many had never experience such a thing before, yet they loved it.

zt-xH4EGhNceq_UGfUaPww.text: Came here for a quick bite to eat. Got the  Chicago style dog (without relish of course!) I've always been afraid of poppy seed buns but it didn't matter, it was delicious! The fries were smacking!! Also try the pizza puff, it's amazing! Reminds me of the pizza pockets from elementary school. My gf was upset there was no desert offered lol, but I'm okay with that. Ill definitely be back for sure

jsvW_AAKNvD5pAflL42XCg.text: I am born and raised in Chicago. So you can believe me when I tell you that  the food served at Windy City Beef N Dogs is "dead on!"  Feels and tastes just like back home including the Chicago Sun Times newspaper on the counter.

cFmcQX4a9w320caJdc39ug.text: Good food, even better customer service. They are dog friendly. My dog and I sar outside. They even gave her a hot dog!

i5EjWqDuN6-igE120tZdwA.text: Windy City Beefs-N-Dogs has the best dogs in town. The service is down home because the owners actually work the business which is hard to find these days! For an authentic Chicago Dog try Windy City I KNOW you'll love it.

9SjVKL0jg53PovzcGmaiBQ.text: We had been wanting to try this place since I had read reviews from Chicago natives that Windy City served authentic Chicago hot dogs & Italian beef sandwiches. We were not disappointed! I loved my first ever Chicago dog. I see what all the fuss is about. The snap when you bite is fantastic. All the toppings added to the taste. The beef sandwich was positively loaded with meat. We got ours dry with the au jus on the side, the better to dip the sandwich & fries in. Those fries! They were hot & crispy served in a brown paper bag. They are among the best fries I have encountered in Las Vegas since moving here. The employees were very helpful & friendly. Windy City gets my highest recommendation for both food & service.

LGFW4dgswP0GMD-hP1nDcw.text: This place does it right. These guys are the real thing. Not posers, not corporate. Good reasonably priced dogs. Big, juicy, Corned Beef Ruben sandwiches, Gyro's, Polish dogs.  All good. The owners work in the restaurant and are very friendly. And once again, reasonably priced with good portions.

h8PAit4SenrGzSA63uhcUQ.text: Everything you would want I'm a hot-dog place. The italian beef is great but they should tell you when are ordering the toppings are $.50 each. After I got done ordering it was $3.00 more. I wasn't  to happy with that. Free icecream to kids.The chicken fingers are okay. I think they were frozen. Hot-dogs are good. I'm going to try more next time I go. I like the names of the day that's cute.

itPSdssr8Qc34YwTrZP76A.text: By far best chicken strips in existence, I prefer the Chicago hot, hot sauce it's like a thick garlicky buffalo. I have to eat them like once every two weeks. Lol. And my boyfriend orders a foot long chili cheese dog add bacon and raw onions. I'm sure all the food is great, but we always order the same thing.

vwfrzC3G6afA8RkbJCZ0qg.text: So far Windy City Beef-n-Dogs is the best Chicago style fast food I've found in Vegas. Too bad it's on the opposite side of town from where I live or I'd go there more often.  They have all the real stuff- Vienna Beef dogs, poppy seed buns, Italian beef, sausage, Maxwell St. Polish, even pizza puffs and tamales. I think they even have Old Style beer on tap!  You can't beat the 2 dog special with fries for $6 when other places in town are charging $6 + for a single dog!  Their beef/sausage combo is as good as any I've had in Chicago. I hadn't had one in almost 2 years and it was really good stuff although a bit expensive.  I think they just recently added gyros sandwiches to their menu and I had one the other night. As with their other stuff the portion was ample and it was made with care. My only gripe is they are using pre sliced gyros and don't have the whole spit - rotisserie setup. I would encourage them to get the whole setup. I know it must be an expensive outlay originally, but having a good gyros in the lineup completes the Chicago menu nicely.  The restaurant looks like it's a family run place. All the people behind the counter are real Chicagoans who put the necessary care into the food and they really respect the tradition. It shows in the quality and taste.  If you want to have your own Chicago cook out, they even sell all the dogs, beef, sausages, buns and fixings by the pound to take home.  I'll continue to go back when I can. How about opening a Henderson location? :-)

y2w9yX_aBBmppbp-ZDPUAA.text: One of my favorites. This is not a health food restaurant! I usually alternate between the Chicago Hot Dogs and the Chicago-Style Beef Sandwich. The employees are nice and friendly; they remember you on your second visit. Service is fast and the food is filling. There is always a ballgame on the TV; a Chicago team if they are playing.

SdKVKYigAJ04bXsuAvPP9A.text: One word for this place: Authentic.  I'm from Chicago, and I'm sick of going someplace, ordering a "Chicago dog," and having some girl from Thousand Oaks serve me something that is anything but Chicago-style. Not here.  This place has legit Chicago everything. Real Maxwell St. Polish and Italian beef.  The Giardiniera is authentic Chicago-style, awesome--no nasty vinegar, just high quality olive oil. If you live too far to get lunch here regularly, I'd stop in and buy Giardiniera to go, it's just that good.  If you're from Chicago you will appreciate a True dipped beef sandwich, an absolute mess of deliciousness. Truly the taste of home. There's nothing like watching the Bulls win or the Cubs lose while enjoying an authentic beef sandwich.  For non-Chicagoans, I can't promise that you'll love it. But I can assure you that this is by far the most authentic Chicago hotdog place in Las Vegas. Can't beat it for a $10 lunch.

TXMlIjGS-K3LwaG7tJXmDg.text: I was born and raised in the Chicago area. I lived in California for thirty years and have been in Vegas for the past 4 years. Thank you Tim for bringing a taste of our home town to Las Vegas. The Beef and Dogs are the real thing!!!!!! If you are from Chicago and have not been to Windy City yet, you are missing out and if you are not from Chicago you don't know what you are missing!! DA BEARS!!! GO CUBBIES!

oGl0vjllZnJ1w_uCxwjbrQ.text: First time here and I think this is, by far, THE best burger I've had in a long time. The hot dogs are also very good and the service was outstanding. Will be coming back soon.

dgMfUWf58hD0LDfCjUm_-A.text: Best French fries I've had in a long time - thin and crispy. Cheap, friendly, chili dog and Italian beef sandwich. Just wish they had brewed iced tea!

tzjDZH804z17OLD78_CuHg.text: One of my (originally from Chicago) family's favorites!  We typically order out from here on one of our birthdays and we've yet to be disappointed. Service is quick & precise, and the food is always tasty. Naturally, we end up leaving with some Green River pop and a bag of Okie Doke, too.  Of course you can't go wrong with a jumbo Chicago dog with fries, but their chicken wings and hamburgers are also good.

yHijWOrIuWDCfUgPn9r-kA.text: This place has the three most important things in the restaurant business. The place was really Clean. The people were amazing. And last but not least, the food was on point.

vit2TSJaQEqm9LSg1nz5VA.text: I'm from Chicago. I know a good Chicago style hot dog and Iti beef sausage when I taste them.  Unfortunately, this place didn't do it for me. The decor is terrific. Reminds me of being in Chicago. Kinda makes me homesick but the dogs and beef were bland. Looks like I'll continue looking for that authentic Chicago taste somewhere in Arizona.

5j08kdVZdKK4rfUQHNF6zA.text: Very good food hands down.  At first, we thought it might've been on the pricier side, but after getting our food, you can definitely see from the portion that you're getting your money's worth.  We split things in order to try everything. We split a dipped Italian beef sandwich, a Chicago dog, a pizza puff, and fries.   The Italian beef was perfect and exactly how it should taste. The Chicago dog was good, as were the fries.  With the pizza puff, i think I was expecting more cheese, but it was more of a meat sauce in it. Still good, just unexpected.   Overall, a pleasant place to eat and would be willing to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A dipped italian beef sandwich, a chicago dog, and a pizza puff. So full now.

HTmdTDzS9gnO16Yw7OSRbw.text: Best Chicago style dogs in town. Super nice service and as authentic as you'll find in Las Vegas.

vWlSVeAFAjCdjUnoow5AUQ.text: My husband ate here for the first time on Thursday, he texted me a picture of the Chicago dog and fries and said it was fantastic. I couldn't resist! So, today, Saturday, we went to check it out again. Yum-o!  Be warned, the fries are the best you will ever eat. Perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned. The staff was super helpful and accommodating. The chili cheese dog I had ROCKED!

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9N2SVDTESopCmLGRuc4tJw.text: Can I just say OMG! This is hands down the one place we stop when we come to town. We found it with a True born and bread Chi town guy! He swore by this place. One bite and we do too this place has a large menu with lots of Chicago favorites for everyone. My favorite is the pizza puff I have them put their chili on top with cheese and onions. My boyfriend loves their beef and sausage sandwiches with their spicy mixed veggies! I have never had anything I don't like and never seen this place empty. Their portions are large and employees friendly. I recommend this place to anyone!!!

82x8QE6DClVdrQyAFXW_0Q.text: Their Chicago Beef was as close to being the real deal. Did not disappoint me and got my cravo g datisfied. The workers were very nice.

14dQhMIvoGADwsa09e7GZg.text: Disappointed with the beef and definitely with the roll. The roll was supermarket quality.

RwyWs8h1leLadjTv3ida5w.text: Came here on a Monday afternoon for lunch with some friends. A little bit of a drive but one of my friends and I have been meaning to try this place out. You order your food at the cashier then find a table yourself.   #4 Windy City's Best of Both Worlds - Vienna Hot Dog & Fries and a 3" Beef Sandwich - (Vienna Premium Beef Hot Dog served on a Steamed Vienna Poppy Seed Bun with all the fixings, Mustard, Onion, Green Relish, Pickle Spear, Tomatoes, Sport Peppers sprinkled with Celery Salt, a 3" Italian Beef Sandwich made with thin slices of Freshly Cooked Beef with our own Au jus served on a Gonnella Italian Style Roll, Served Dry, Wet, or Dipped. Served with Fries) - I got my sandwich wet with medium peppers (serrano/jalepeno level? apparently their hot was habenero level.... ouch)  The hot dog was pretty good. Soft bun with all the fixings. pickles and tomato gives it a nice crunch and bright flavor. Pretty good compared to the normal hot dog from like Sam's Club (big price difference but thats not the point here LOL)   I was told about this place after trying Big Al's and their dipped sandwiches. I opted for wet vs dipped because i've read reviews (maybe not for this place specifically) but dipped may be too wet and hard to eat. To be honest, even wet was quite uhm wet. Flavors seemed pretty comparable to Big Al's. Maybe i'm not too experienced or knowledgable in this style of beef sandwiches so i cant say much. Still pretty good overall.   The price of this combo is actually not bad. Got me quite full. Should opt out from getting a drink and ask for a water cup though. Adding a drink bumps price from $7.95 + tax to over $11 after tax. XD (im a cheapo shush).

hl94IrLGWbn_S4GDOZVhfg.text: All I can say about this place is WOW!  This is the best Italian Beef in town. It is a nice little hole in the wall sandwich and hot dog joint. While I was in there today, the owner was in training a new girl. She took great care looking around the place to make sure everything was up to par. It definitely shows that the employees take great pride in the place.   I like how you can sit at the bar and watch your food being cooked. You know there is nothing to hide that way.  I have eaten here numerous times and I will always go back when I am on that side of town. Absolutely the best Chicago Dog and Italian Beef sandwiches in town. I have also had their sausage and beef combo sandwich and it is fantastic.   My usual order - the #10 dipped, very wet, sweet peppers, cheese, and hot giardinera. Fries and a drink.    The hot giardinera is really tasty and spicy. They also have mild and medium giardinera if you don't want that much spice.   Trust me...check this place out!  You'll love it!

XwnazP0YxEkgtz_7CA6E8A.text: Let's say it was a pleasant surprise to finally find a beef place in another city, other than Chicago, that was spot on to Chicago beef.  My husband owned a beef stand for many years in chicago and this beef was just the same.  The hot dog was spot on to Chicago and even my tamale was authentic Chicago style.  Thanks Windy City.  We will be back every year!

vlSyAwrsHtc-aL-dGObY8g.text: Not sure where to start!  The hot dogs were like going to Jimmys on Pulaski and Grand Ave in Chicago, Italian Beef was also great. But let me tell you what makes it complete. Their Chicago Deep Dish Pizza, wow!! Since we found this place, we have been bringing the girls here almost every week. Whats nice is, they also sell the Chicago Tamales like all the dog joints back home. Your looking for Chi Town dogs, this is your place.

acR7nGP4aYeS03WkIB1qxg.text: Great quick service establishment the staff is friendly and knowlegable.  I will order; 2 Chicago Dogs w/everything and a large chili add cheese. Chili is homemade and real flip'n good.  Or... either. Italian Beef Combo soaked w/sweet & hot. Fries are skinny and crisp w/just the rite amount of salt powder.  I chow here 4x's a month since the place open. The joint is kept very clean. Good job my fellow Chicagoan!   Oh yea... 1 do have one complaint, they never pick the name Joe to feature on the daily chalk board. lol... Cmon it is yelp, ya gotta complain about something. DA BEARS! GO HAWKS! GO SOXS! and _ da cubbies!

UPzVCJzzyV3UEQGUo6_u0g.text: Service here is usually really great. Today the cashier who took my order was extremely rude and impatient. She definitely did not have mid western ways. Not sure if I will be traveling so far to order from them

dp3mSPpw8NQhwBTFTRGn_w.text: I adore their Chicago dogs! Also my favorites are the spicy Polish sausage, the gyro and who doesn't like roast beef?  I can't say enough about this place I love everything! Also the staff is super friendly.

YTDljwhgGZjf-60f5STPGA.text: This is a wedge of Chicago in Las Vegas. I try to swing through once a week just to get a quick injection of cholesterol. The people are amazing EVERYTIME I've gone in. The fries are perfectly done each and every time. The Chicago style hot dogs are pretty close to what I had when I was a young man in Chicago. The main difference is that where I went in Chicago had wedges of tomato vs slices. Not a big deal, but you know... its kind of like "not how my momma made it" sort of thing. The italian beef is pretty close to spot on. Its a little less spice than Al's in Chicago. My recommended way of having it is "wet", with sweet peppers and I almost always add the melted cheese. Hopefully my cardiologist isn't reading this.

tV76T_j2sPdbnRHqTk6Icg.text: Dipped!  If you know beefs, you know what I mean......So do they!  Nuff said. Authentic hot dogs and polish sausage.....Maxwell street style. Pizza puffs!  If you're new to this and have never tasted a TRUE Chicago hot dog, be sure to get it without all of the junk on it and just get it with ketchup.

2ARYoY5eJUehBjEjy6XxPA.text: This is the best hole in the wall, mom and pop restaurant! I highly recommend making this a Vegas must visit place.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #10 windy city&#39;s Chicago style Italian beef sandwich with peppers

xlOK00CVV5q1AWZuspNgGA.text: Great authentic Chicago dog place!   Chicago dog is a must try here and get it the way it is, no alterations. Also, it's not a complete meal without an Italian beef sandwich. Go Cubs!

G0XRW19448Hwnx_q2HHsxQ.text: If you think mall food courts are amazing then you might like it here.   Cheap food, Rude and confrontational service, the atmosphere of a busy subway station.  Do your arteries a favor and skip this joint, although its hot dogs are better than 7 Eleven's.  Fast food without the "fast".

g7m14zI3NBaKTDYYxGAV1w.text: The food is traditional Chicago comfort food and the people traditional Chicago comfort people.Great place.

yIcz9b8KQyVDxinhcy0d9g.text: Oh, so that's a Chicago Style dog?  This was my first time trying one.  I must have eaten it wrong, because I was not impressed.    All the parts of the dog were good, but they didn't add up to much.  The dogs are high quality Vienna Beef, and have a great snap.  The only other ingredient that made the dog distinctive were the tomatoes.  I expected the bright green pickle relish to contribute something significant to the flavor profile, but it really didn't.  The poppy seed bun was unremarkable.  I ordered a combo that came with a bag of french fries.  The french fries photographed well (LOL), but they were totally limp.  Nobody like limp fries.  Clearly I should've went for a bag of Jay's chips.  Now, I realize all this just doesn't add up.  It must be my fault.  Clearly, I must have eaten it wrong.     I failed on my first try, but I'm not giving up.  I'm definitely going back to Windy City next time I'm in town. I'm gonna have a Chicago Dog and I'm gonna like it.    Mikey C says:            So your brother's bound and gagged            And they've chained him to a chair            Won't you please come to Chicago just to sing?

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Windy City on a Rainy Day.
Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Presentation is everything.  Just kidding. It&#39;s what&#39;s inside that counts.
Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries look great, but they&#39;re limp and just better avoided. They have Jays potato chips. Go with the chips.

dKLHloLyEbFTQuwZzic_2g.text: There's a popular Chicago style hot dog place in Honolulu but I have to say, Windy City serves up an undeniable beat down to that place with one hand tied behind its back.  The dogs at Windy City just taste better and have more of an "authentic" vibe to them instead of place like the one in Honolulu that's "trying" too hard to be a Chicago dog.  Stepping in here for the first time, I knew it was going to be good because for a cold, Tuesday evening, it was packed and with many walk in take out orders.  There was even one lady that came in to order a couple of dogs to go dressed in her house robe.  Like she was at home watching The Voice and decided she wanted a hot dog and walked over. ;)  The 2 things I've tried here...  The combo Italian beef and sausage sandwich (#13).  Large amounts of shaved beef piled on top of an Italian sausage (mild or hot) which is sandwiched in an Italian roll.  This thing was HUGE!  You can get other stuff added to it like Cheese (cheddar or mozz), Sweet peppers, and Giardinera.  I ordered mine with a spicy sausage, sweet peppers and medium giardinera...and with the whole sandwich dipped in beef jus!  It was hard to eat but I managed...hehe.  On the second visit, I had to try one of the dogs so I got the Footlong Vienna Maxwell Street Polish Dog (#16), another monster.  This polish dog is steamed then fried which gave it a nice snap when biting into it.  The dog is topped with grilled onions, mustard and sport peppers.  I got mine with nuclear green chicago style relish.  Super filling and delicious.  This one comes with fries as well!   Mark H had the Chicken fingers on both visits and he said they're really good.  Service on both visits was super friendly and the food came out quickly.    Wind City is a must come back to for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12&#34; polish dog with relish. Comes with fries.
Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian beef and sausage sandwich, dipped

zqM__QM3nIPNAUZr6PUyCw.text: Yes!! What a find on my way back from a 5+ hour hike at Red Rocks.  A quick Yelp search for lunch spots brought me here and since I had such good luck in the area for breakfast I figured I would roll the dice on getting a real Chicago dog just a few miles outside the strip.  Tucked in a strip mall I knew this place was the real deal when I walked in.  If someone blindfolded you and dropped you inside you would swear you were on South Wacker and not in the middle of the desert.     Got the Chicago Dog (of course) and chili cheese fries since I had some calories to replenish.  The dog was awesome, the real deal - onions, relish, peppers, pickle, tomato, celery salt and the signature poppy seed bun.   Cooked perfectly - great snap and all the toppings were fresh and delicious.  Same deal on the fries - thin and perfectly crisp with a great later of chili and cheese on top.  Not sure if it's intended to be a single serving but it was for me!  Believe the reviews - this place nails it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili cheese fries!
Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chicago!

RvKBJuyMITN2BDkvljjLcA.text: If you like Chicago style hotdogs and Chicago sports to go with it, Windy City is a must try when in Vegas. They have legitimate sausages (Vienna), buns, and toppings, including the bright green relish. The fries come in a brown bag so you can see the oil. Fresh cut fries would make it even better.   Staff is very friendly and the restaurant has lots of decoration featuring Chicago sports.

fWU70qcm9XASHQTHWCoVEA.text: They wings are amazballz.  The sauces are delicious.  I usually do the Chicago heat, however today I decided to try the habanero sauce. Another wonderful flavor to go with the best wings in Vegas.   The chili fries are so good.  Or try it on a hot dog.   Both are worth it. Yummy!!   I also enjoy the corn dogs. And you can't forget the cheesecake on a stick.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. November Specials

ACTX8zB-tzwqyNiufF45NA.text: One of the best hot dog spots I have eaten at in a long time. I thank all the staff for the hospitality and great customer service!!   Go go to Windy City beef dogs won't be sorry

J00tXXdF66xEV05hwVOL-w.text: I have been coming to Windy City for about 6 years now and my family and I have never had a bad experience. Went there today and got the Chicago dog which is always awesome! It's a little taste of Chicago that you really can't get anywhere else. Inside is always clean and the staff is so welcoming. They acknowledge your presence as soon as you walk in (with the exception of when it's extremely busy, of course). Love this place and would recommend it to anyone looking for a authentic Chicago meal.

HOX7TRAREUmDMLBDMQ3sNQ.text: Love this place!  Every time I come here everything is fresh cooked to order and fantastic.  Burgers, dogs, sausage and their gyro is awesome.

T-YoYxBjACoc1FAHTaH0BA.text: It's a Chicago beef done well.  Bread is comparable to Gonnella.  They lose a star for the cost.  If it were in Chicago they would have to lower their price because the competition would force them to.  Here they can get away with it.  Tasty food - a little too expensive for an everyday lunch place.

cAHY2E-NojHoPC5fwNU1YQ.text: I love OG Italian beefs. Grew up on them. My beef was seasoned well and the hot giardenara was excellent.  The one thing I did not like was on top my sandwich was really salty. I'm not sure at what point they added the salt but it was way too much. That's why the 3 stars. Other than that this real deal chi town beef spot would have been better. They have Vienna dogs with the works and also sausages both polish and Italian style. For me the salt killed it.   I will be back but next time I will try their daily specials. Much better value served with fries and drink for under $10.

FSrOLiUfyX9sY5O5wFOYpQ.text: I really can't tell you how well the chicago dog was compared to others; it's the first I've ever had. So, so good!

fGVH4MLQ0u9iPG1sXaGlPg.text: My husband wanted to try this place. We got my son a simple hot dog he ate it. My daughter ordered a tamale (it came in a sealed plastic wrapper) she didn't like it at all. She thought she was getting a real Tamale LOL. My husband and I ordered a Reuben Sandwich.  It was probably the best we've had. Great flavor!!!!  After our meal I purchased the spicy popcorn and the hot mixture thing they sale. Very good customer service.  My 3 year old son went up and bought a drink and the lady was so sweet. Before we left they offered our kids sherbet ice cream on the house! Love this place we will be back

FpMzPOwPSsSRkw9OC8WV-w.text: Loved everything I ate here. Especially the pizza puff. Will definitely be back. Service was amazing as well as the food.

UWLkUBLY2X1gA87zgCI4IQ.text: We Ordered: #4 Best of Both Worlds Combo #15 Davenco Gyro & Black Cherry Soda 2 - #10 Italian Beef Sandwich Combos  The food was great. It came out fast. The total was only $40 and all 4 of us left full. I love that they have Black Cherry Soda !!!!!!!

0zsSpYVDOJ4qM3ZU58bwWg.text: I'm proud to say I'm not from Chicago, since I hate cold weather! But what I can tell you is that this place has the BEST hotdogs I've ever eaten. In fact I never really cared for hotdogs until I came here! And the skinny fries are so Ono! I can't wait to get back over there for a chili dog! One day I'm going to be brave and try the Chicago dog! Bon appetite!

D08UMhju7F1U66IH290PGw.text: VERY good food, fist time here and they do have the best Hot Dogs and Polish Sausage. They have great Daily deals and a large selection of combos to choose from, the staff here was very patients and nice, clean place to eat great atmosphere

rdwsZTe21P9r3t5U-T1j4Q.text: Tried this place today for lunch. I got the   #5 Windy City's Maxwell Street Polish & Fries  A Vienna Polish Sausage, Plain or Spicy, Steamed then grilled to perfection, served on a Steamed Vienna Poppy Seed Bun served with Mustard, Grilled Onions & Sport Peppers. Served with Fries. All this yummy goodness for 6 bucks. Can't beat that. Service is fast and friendly. I will be back to try something different!

ECO9qDX9x3sv2xa_qCaZbQ.text: This place is great been coming here for a while but I must say tried this new place Chicago craving it's also on Lake mead and it was amazing to! I'm from Chicago love to have somewhere to eat that's like back home!

mrFwK5bxEE-elypJ9i-XxA.text: I saw a few reviews on this place and decided to check it out. I had no idea it was so close to us and right next to the Von's I frequent. Not sure how I overlooked this place.  I'm originally from northern Illinois, about 90 miles outside of Chicago. My wife had never been to Illinois until a couple of years ago. While there we went to Taste of Chicago where she had her first Chicago dog and immediately fell in love.  We have been to Windy City twice in the past two weeks since discovering it. The second time we invited my parents who also were in search of a little taste of home.  The first time we went, my wife got the Chicago dogs and a Green River (limey ginger ale soda). I got the Italian sausage and a pizza puff. I'm not  a big fan of hot dogs, but my wife confirmed they were solid reproductions of authentic Chicago dogs. The Italian sausage was decent. I had never had a pizza puff before and am now a fan. My wife's meal came with fries which were really good, nice and thin and crispy. Just the way I like them.  The second time we went my wife again got a Chicago dog. I got an Italian beef sandwich. I don't think I'd ever had an Italian beef sandwich before. I got mine dipped with cheese, peppers, and giardinera. I liked mine a lot. I think I'll get that again. I might get it wet though, which ironically is drier than the dipped. The dipped was really good but the sogginess made it difficult to eat.

_L8ddfQnvre_zN8-l8vgxg.text: Great food. Hot dogs are awesome and I am not from Chicago!!! Everything is made to order. They are so nice and accommodating. You will not be disappointed!!!!

K4J0RiD1n7WRP-xlLa3eCg.text: I haven't had a hot dog in years and it was worth the wait. Friendly staff. The dog was perfect. It was hot, juicy and dripping with flavor. The only thing missing was a ball game, a movie, or a family reunion.

PojgdfsveWjiP6dELuUKHw.text: Being from Chicago, I'm finding it very difficult to review this place. My most favorite place in Chicago for hot dogs, polishes and fries is Byron's. The polish and fries can't hang with that of Byron's, next time I'll try something else. My kids had hot dogs, which they loved! My husband had the dipped combo and chose the spicy sausage topped with hot giardinieras. He said it reminded him of Al's in Chicago (that's a good thing).   Even though I didn't like what I ordered, my husband and kids did. It was an overall good experience with friendly staff and clean surroundings.

4UEV_aLwRqleaLenUiGG8A.text: Oooo this place is trouble. And when I say that, I mean trouble for the other hot dog chains out there. this hot dog joint is more of a keeper than your mama's pearl earrings given to you when you turned 16.  There's nothing fancy about this place and its eats. And that's how a hot dog joint should be. Came in and it's a lil more spacious than your average hot dog stand on a street. i ordered my hotdog(#1) with some fries and a drink. my order came faster than i can take a picture for yelp. but of course not like a fast food chain. when the lady delivered my food, i can smell the freshness of the hot dog, peppers, mustard, even the poppy-seeds(jk). but the thin freshly fried seasoned(lowry's?) fries were double the amount of the hot dog, which was able to fill me up. it came in a basket, in your typical brown paper bag and paper wrap with no name. anti-fancy. thank you for that. did i forget to say how delicious the food was? yes, there's not much to do when it comes to hot dogs, just the hot dog, bun, and a bunch of toppings. but they fulfilled the meat's destiny just right.   oh, you bet i'll be back.
