6chVRZhJC36OL5-cAm-i1g.text: Hidden inside a strip mall is a lil' hole in the wall restaurant that serves authentic chicago fare. Think open kitchen, bar stools and diner tables.  I always get their French Dip with Roast Beef.... it's amazingly good. If you like peppers, ask for them to add hot peppers to it. They make their own and I just can't get enough of it. My friends also swear by their burgers. Lots of people were getting the polish dog that day and it looks enormous (ha ha insert joke) and very delicious - going to get it next time!  The staff here is also super friendly and I believe it's a mom and pop shop, which makes me want to go back even more!

OD1_6C92zuoZzTJZEIfg4w.text: Yes another spot my love introduced me to, well he is a local and knows all the best places. We ate a huge Italian beef with giardiniera, and you have to get it with giardiniera! It was so delicious, we totally forgot to take a picture. We could not stop eating! The staff is really nice, and friendly. PS they have a board by the register and if your first name is one of the names they selected you get a free hot dog! SWEET!

RaR9NG2wbzOW09SzrnWF7g.text: Great place with great food. The staff are super friendly and the restaurant is nice and clean. Man, I might just come back here tomorrow.

MztxzS4JjQ-6dsWceeGJ-w.text: Love this place for a quick bite at lunch time or on the weekend. Great food, good service with character. Good prices. Be sure to check out the specials calendar each month for fun promotions like free hotdog today if your name is Dan or Diane and awesome daily specials on food. Also they carry some Midwest soda a lot of people here in vegas have never had.

uOdyPtlcYsBN_Bjaz2b13A.text: Was on the way home and remembered to finally stop by this joint and take it off my "To Do List".....thank God I did!  It was 10:45 am and I wondered if they would be open.....they were, lucky me!  I was greeted by the owner and his Wife.....at least it appeared as if they owned the joint.  They were very friendly and welcoming.  It's a casual restaurant with 10 or 12 tables inside and 8-10 counter seats near the grill.  There's also a few tables outside with umbrellas if you like to dine outdoors.  I browsed the menu and was getting excited with every item I saw.....Vienna Beef Dogs, Beef Sandwiches, Iltaco Pizza Puffs......WAIT, Pizza Puffs?!  Holy $hit, that changes everything....I love those things!  I couldn't control myself, so I ordered a #2 Two Chicago Dogs w/Relish, Pickle Spear, Tomato, Hot Peppers, Mustard, Onions, Seasoned Salt....and Fries ($6.00)....plus I ordered a Pizza Puff ($3.50) and washed it down with a bottle of Coke Zero.  Dammit, there goes the diet!  The lady asked for my name and asked if I was dining in or taking out....I told her dine-in.  I saddled up to a table and anxiously waited for the food.  While I was waiting I noticed a man with his Son sitting at the counter.  They were eating Chicago Dogs and he was telling his Son how a Chicago Dog is made and how it should taste....the owner, who was grilling it up was there telling the kid about how to make the Dog....it was awesome.  After a few minutes my order was ready.  The lady brought it out to my table....I unwrapped both Dogs and the bag of Fries and put them together on one wrap so I could eat it uninterrupted.  She told me the Pizza Puff was still cooking so it would be a few minutes....that's pretty standard to wait for Pizza Puffs, so I didn't care.  The Dogs were covered in Mustard, which is how I like it.....if you don't like too much Mustard on your Dog, I suggest you tell them ahead of time.  The first bite was an explosion of Awesome on my taste buds....it was sooo good!  The Vienna Beef Dog was full of flavor and the combination of toppings was just how I remember the Dogs in Chi-town.  The Relish is the atomic green colored stuff you find in Chi-town.  This place is legit!  The Fries were piping hot and seasoned with a Salty seasoning....if you don't like your Fries too Salty, then I suggest you either ask for them plain or tell them easy on the seasoning.  I liked it.  It complimented the Dogs just right.  The Dogs were average size.....not too big, do don't expect a 1/4 lb Dog with the #2.  I think they offer larger Dogs with other combo meals, but not with the #2.  The Pizza Puff came out shortly after I started eating.  I waited until I was done with the Dogs before I moved over to that bad boy.  It was wrapped in the traditional Iltaco Pizza Puff wrapper.....those of you familiar with Pizza Puffs know what I'm talking about.  I bit into the greasy, flaky, doughy Crust and mmmm.....yeah, it's the Pizza Puff that I've grown to love.  Inside of the flaky, doughy Crust is a filling of Pizza Sauce, Sausage, and Cheese.  Dammit, these things are addicting and I just discovered this place....I have a feeling I will be here often.  The owners were very attentive and asked if I was ok and needed anything.  After I was finished, they asked how I liked it....I gave them the thumbs up and a big smile.  They were smiling too and said "See you soon Peter!"......I love family owned businesses who pay attention to their customers.  While I was there 6 or 7 people came in and they knew all of them by first name.  I hope I get to know them better too.  Will I return?  This place has won my clogged artery Heart....you bet I will!  Now, back to the gym to burn off these calories.

X7B-KtBL7lviypmNJzdc3Q.text: My food was good but the rest of the family's wasn't , so I can't give it more than three stars! My chili cheese dog was good, but my husband ate his burger and immediately got sick. None of the kids liked their hot dogs. Maybe they were having a bad day? tpt08mRGUbeuJyqlSw-k6w.text: Teleport me to Chicago!  Let's start by saying, I'm not a big hotdog person. In fact I was hospitalized when I was younger, eating a hotdog and getting fairly bad food poisoning.  This isn't the case here. I had heard from a few people that this was the place to get a hotdog in Las Vegas. Walking in I had no idea what I wanted, being from Australia hotdogs are not really a staple or rarely served. I asked the nice lady behind the counter what are the two best hotdogs to get and she served me up the chill dog and a Chicago dog.  The decor of the place is Chicago, from sporting teams, city pictures and other great trinkets from Chitown.  The food was great, the service was better! And I will say go where the locals go, eat what the locals eat, well this is where people from Chicago go eat!

U6ed2jjI1IWGw-6JQL8oRg.text: A MUST when are in Vegas. great food great variety and friendly staff. Will be back next time I am in town.   GO KINGS GO !!!

6Qm1WY_3hfRuY6PXyMS5qQ.text: Great little place for lunch. I am from south of Chicago and this place is as close as you can get to a Chicago dog. awesome!.

Di5hHl7WFdK942lneQy0Ug.text: This place is fantastic!!! It was our first time coming here and won't be our last! Very friendly staff. The beef sandwich was all I expected it to be and more I ordered it dipped so it was extremely messy (I may order it wet next time) it had just the right flavor and the meat to roll ratio was just right. The fries were awesome too. My husband got the beef and sausage combo and no complaints there either. Great amount of food for your money too you don't leave hungry that's for sure. It's gonna be our go to place once a month!!

X6sXP5hACZQEZ8T_O3Y56A.text: Been here a few times already, and it's consistent with great food, great service, and honestly the cleanest public restroom too lol. Their fries are addictive, and I'll keep coming back for more.

XsQTKvOTxFGADhyaODnyGA.text: My girlfriend and I were looking for something quick for lunch. A friend told me about Windy City, so we decided to give it a try. The food was excellent and really hit the spot. As we were waiting to order, my G/F noticed a sign that said if your name is James, you get a free hot dog! My lucky day! Anyway...give this place a try...it's clean, friendly and inexpensive!

EZGNt1Z_rNRX90Vz04Xjhw.text: We kind of wound up here on a whim after coming to an impasse over where to eat. My buddy said his place was pretty good and he was driving, so tubular meat it was. The menu was rather impressive, boasting more than just hot dogs. They offer a variety of sandwiches and burgers, along with the dogs. I contemplated a burger, but opted for a Chicago Style Dog. The dog was pretty good, the french fries were average. The combo will run you about ten bucks. This is one of those places with limited space inside, so avoid the traditional noontime lunch, if you are able, or you will be cramped at a little table. They do have some outside seating, which is only a viable option if the outside temperature cooperates. The staff was friendly and attentive, but the cramped quarters were kind of a turn off.

CtKVAQgE0IUndyCjBKfE4g.text: Strolled by this place in the Vons shopping center several times. Finallllllly broke down and tried it one Sunday.   So worth it. Got the italian sausage with peppers. so delicious and flavorful. Fair prices great staff. I'll definitely be back.

yMBVgGPqKwgqm2w4ZYwY6Q.text: There is really nothing wrong with the place, the owners provide good customer service, the food comes out pretty fast and the food is good for a quick lunch. However, there is really nothing extraordinary about the place. I will say the best deal will be the hot dog with the 3" beef sandwich! I liked the fact that they give you different discounts depending on the day, for example if your address has a 3 you will get a free bag of chips!

Q2BmCWf1YyvlUwhQZdX04Q.text: If you've ever had the great Chicago Dogs while in Chicago and you wish you could have one again?  Stop wishing and stop by Windy City.  Just like back home.

1fKo69EneZGAV_Aw990DzA.text: Very nice luncheon spot. Ordering is easy..service prompt.....we sat outside on a table adjacent to the parking lot. The hot dogs are very tasty....the sesame seed bun is different but delicious....all folks working seemed quite friendly. All the hot dog and burger meals come with fries which is a nice touch. prices are fairly modest. I had a double play dog.....wife had just a single Chicago  hot dog and my son had a foot long Vienna chili cheese dog. no issues at all. I enjoyed my hot dog experience so much I even bought a T-shirt.

fG1HGPPBf8DSyc4Wzjyn2w.text: Nicest people you could ever meet.   Food was like Chicago. Had a combo beef and sausage.   Brought me back to my childhood.   Please come here.   It is worth it.

gkFx3evHSGaOPr1I2j_OWA.text: My mother and brother were born and raised in Chicago, and I love Chicago-style food.  Until now, I'd not found a good place in Vegas to get an Italian beef sandwich or a real Chicago dog.  I have now.  They even have all the fixin's for sale, including the Vienna Beef hot dogs, sport peppers, and giardinare.  Forget about Al's, come here.  They also have another location where they serve Chicago pizza, but I've not tried them (yet).  But I promise I will.

b_4txtDla8Rrq3pEtvVy5g.text: Yummy dogs and sandwiches. The staff was super friendly and helpful. We had a variety of menu items and enjoyed them all.

A0KYZnQ9fhhgzNjodVBfaA.text: The MIL was hoping we'd pick some good old American fare so I found this place was close by their house and thought 4.5 star average can't be wrong.   I got the #4 Hot dog & 3in beef sandwich w/ fries ($7.95).   I love Chicago dogs and theirs is pretty legit, though not my favorite in town. I realized I prefer a snappy dog than a softer, boiled dog which I have the option elsewhere.  I dont like when boiled dogs wet the bread either. It's just a preference and is not a reflection that this place is bad. I think if you're feeling a Chi-dog, this should be on the short list as this is pretty close to what I've had in Chicago.     The beef sandwich comes with different options: au jus- dipped, wet or side, cheese, giardiniera- hot or mild. I put my au jus on the side and good thing since the sandwich was already kind of wet and falling apart. I didn't feel the au jus added much and half the cup was oil. The giardiniera was pretty good and I got the hot kind and it was spicy! That was just okay and just a bit too soggy and greasy for my liking.  Just doesn't settle right with me- Windy City indeed! I blamed it on my MILs old dog though! The fries were thin cut, seasoned well and crispy- these are how I like my fries! My BF also got the same combo and the MIL and grandma split one and sandwich was the least favorite.  My MIL got the footlong chili and cheese dog w/ fries ($5.75) and I took a bite. I'm not a chili type person, but I try a bite whenever my BF or MIL order chili items and this was pretty good. The BF said he'd order it next time and she thought it was tasty.  The service was alright. There was a mistake on the order, but they were quick to correct it. The lady who brought us our order came back to check on us and was friendly. This really isn't a full service place though- the drinks, condiments, utensils, trash is DIY and you order at the counter.   I can see why people like this place as it's comfort type foods. I can't really say my experience was 4 star worthy as there was aspects of the food I liked and then there are parts that fell short. I think we will return specially since the in laws enjoyed themselves. I would like to try their Polish sausage since it's grilled to get snappy next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #4 hot dog&amp; 3inch beef sandwich

D_Z8a4xzy7Pt4WU9rpaXmg.text: I've never been to Chicago, couldn't tell you what a real Italian beef sandwich from there tastes like... Now I can tell you that the beef sandwich from Windy City is one of my favorite sandwiches I've eaten... I get mine wet with the medium gardinier(sp) and mozzarella... Such a great flavor combo!! The bread does get soggy, but that doesn't bother me one bit. Just makes you eat it faster. The service is top notch, the staff is always super friendly... Overall I highly recommend Windy City and will continue trying new things from there each visit... Did I mention they have frozen cheesecake on a stick??!!

Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Italian Beef, Wet, mild gardinier, and Mozzarella.... Yum!!!

WykpGmeZ2M96Ky1ualCrrw.text: We have tried the chili cheese fries twice and today I got a 12oz chili cup with cheese and onions. The #1-Chicago style hot dogs & fries is their most popular and it is soooo good! I have also had the Italian beef sandwich-very nice. The chili cheese dog is a great choice as well. Ra1gpJ2m_JAMbQtcBi0WBw.text: Fantastic place for anyone  from Chicago or anyone that wants authentic chicago style food. They were extremely friendly and the food was great! ksRrO5C3nEuKfKiyACGz-A.text: As all my friends will attest to, I'm a picky eater. So to get 5 stars from me is rare. My two all time favorite foods are nachos and chili dogs with chili fries.     I have been on a Mecca to find the best of all three in town. The chili dog and fries blow the competition out of the water. I have two really good friends from Chicago and Boston so I'm bringing them here for their reviews next. Cheap, excellent food, and my server was both cute and nice! A+. Since I have written this review I found another place just as good and closer to home. Great Links.

cXlwPwmFHypv-6_0svl1fg.text: This is the place for chili cheese fries. Wish I would've taken a pic!   They're so good, I LOVE them. My kids & husband do as well.  I don't care for the other food much but we'll go out of our way for the chili cheese fries.  Chick strips are crispy and ok tasting.  It's not overly priced and it's enough for two! RvUhgTJ3Hq5FF1qy9B-Bfg.text: My 85 year old mom my sister and I went here to eat and the food is great but a woman working there not so much I asked for a water cup for my mom to pour some of Are soda into because my mom can not hold the big cup and soda only comes in one size. When she came to Are table and saw soda in the cup she said she has to charge us 2.50 I said why she said because there is soda in the cup I told her it was from the soda we purchased she said so it doesn't matter there is soda in the cup this mad me so mad because my mom is 85 for one and we paid for the soda we was giving mom so what is the problem. nzJyLtkaj2-cOwZzXY_a2w.text: I can't say enough of this little place .. it was my mom and I first time at the restaurant.. We where welcomed right when we walked in  Second mom said very very clean bathroom. That's important to my mom.   We had a spicy Polish and Chicago dog and we shared the Italian beef sandwich.. the best beef sandwich I had , thin sliced !! The best ever!! 1sPVclw_RUK59Ukf2iAoLA.text: It's hard finding good, yummy...True to taste "back home" eats...so this place is satisfactory for me when I have that crave. In the past I've had the Chicago style Polish...and boy was it spot on. Today I'm trying the Italian beef, wet, with extra hot and sweet peppers. I also opted to try two versions of their mild sauce to see if it's that Chicago mild that I know from back home...they were both good, but far from the mild sauce I know. The color for the south side mild was correct...but it didn't taste the same. The buffalo mild color was almost there...that didn't taste the same as back home either. They both were good in their own ways though. The italian beef was very tasty...just a different from what I know, but it was still good. Overall taste is it's own version of Chicago that's close enough for me for most items, especially when you've been going through years of withdrawal from "back home food", and spot on for the dogs for sure. I'll be back

7oO9ktgOGQMtdeXbccITEw.text: I need to start this review by saying that I have never had a Chicago beef sandwich before. I went with a friend who is from Chicago and recommended this place. She considers it to be extremely authentic and has been here many times.  We split the 9-inch beef sandwich with cheese. We also shared an order of fries. I found the bread and the beef to be very fresh. I probably would have liked the sandwich a little bit more with the peppers and other garnishes, but since we were splitting, we ate it plain with just the cheese. The french fries were delicious. It seems like they make them from scratch with real potatoes but they are cooked longer than the in-and-out style fries.  Drinks are self-serve from a fountain that offers Coke products. Diet Coke, not Coke Zero, in case you're one. They also have a cooler with some bottled drinks.  Something that I found extremely nice about this place was the service. You order at the counter and pay and then they bring you your food. I was surprised at how much attention we got from that point on. Usually once you've done that, you are on your own. Not here! A couple of times they came to check and make sure we didn't need anything like ketchup and in the end to see if we were ready for them to clear our table. Definitely Midwestern hospitality. Also, they run a clean restaurant!  I was impressed with how busy they were. There were customers filling the inside of the restaurant. It was a beautiful day so we sat at a table outside.  I would definitely recommend this place if you are in the mood for a Chicago beef or a fancy hot dog.

-jdcFfmw6bzWurrebtIQkw.text: Was in the mood for some hot dogs and found this place right down the street from us.   We didn't realize they closed at 8:00, we arrived at 7:58 . They greeted us very well and took our order and didn't mention anything about closing. We apologized once we realized we walked in as soon as they were getting ready to close. We felt so bad because we hate being "those LAST customers" but the staff was so nice and told us not to worry about that .  My husband ordered the number 10 based on recommendation. And he ordered it wet. With lots of cheese. I don't remember what it was exactly called but it had LOTS of flavor. It was a little too wet for my liking, but he enjoyed it. And the size was BIG.   I ordered the number 1; a lot smaller in comparison lol. But good amount for me .  More on the plain side but still yummy. It does come with peppers so it has a kick to it.   THE FRIES were one of my favorite! I LOVE fries and I can say WINDY CITY has some GREAT fries.  The style is very Chicago theme. They have all sorts of pictures on the wall and it all relates to Chicago. We didn't have too much time to take a look around, but I'm sure next time we will.   Customer service was GREAT. Thank you WINDY CITY DOGS .

Bat1dNsmSLhc_FEOAV03dA.text: They have south side mild sauce!!   True Chicago atmosphere!! They treat you well and the food tastes even better.

UzTk-Pu2hdCLKfagYLSV4g.text: Hot diggity dog! I was craving for some hot dogs so I stopped by to get takeout today for lunch.  This is a counter-serve joint and the dining area is decorated with Chicago memorabilia.  I ordered the Chicago dogs and fries. It delivered an authentic style hotdog with all the traditional windy city fixings. I like the celery salt on the dog, it gave that extra pop to go with the tomatoes and sport peppers that came with it.  The 2nd order is the  "Windy City's Maxwell Polish" and I liked this better and this one is a Vienna Polish sausage and you can get it plain or spicy, and I chose spicy. They steam the sausage then grill it and serve it on a Vienna poppy seed muffin with mustard, grilled onions and sport peppers.   I also ordered their Chicken wings and the sauces for the wings are mild to hot and you can request the sauce to be tossed or on the side. We thought the wings were so tasty.  They all came with a side of fries and were perfectly crispy and topped with a season salt.  Most menu items are under $10 for hot dogs and sandwiches. Prices are fair. Check out the chalkboard in front of register for specials of the day.

aO57r6vZzIV1VpgOEK5eMw.text: Great  friendly people working here! Best Italian beef I've had! Beef was tender tasty and perfect size! A True Italian beef!  The fries were crispy fresh and seasoned just right!  I will make this my frequent stop!

h4u62ewTl7DmcrPgGAsj4A.text: Authentic Chicago hotdogs and atmosphere! Once inside you won't feel in Las Vegas, everything from the menu to the hockey memorabilia on the walls transport you to Chicago. Service is very friendly; one of the staff members came to our table offering free ice cream to a child in our party. They also have a name of the day board featuring a male and a female name, and if your ID shows it to be your name you get a free hotdog. Let's talk about the important stuff; a large menu of dogs every imaginable style, all made with Vienna Beef products. I went for the foot-long street polish dog; served with spicy mustard, grilled onions and jalapeno peppers, a devoured that thing and wished I could go for more, but I was full. I am determined to return try every item on the menu!

U2EE66OupEAh-7eBplnysw.text: This place is awesome! OGs from Chicago that make you feel like family. I've had the #1, it was awesome! Trying the chargrilled #18 today. In a city where personal service is lost,  this is a diamond in the rough. Thank you!

WU7h0NatBJUATdwaEvPEMQ.text: Being from Chicago is a great thing. We love food and we especially love Italian beef and hot dogs.  I have tried a few places in the Vegas area but tonight I found out about Windy City.  The dogs are Vienna and served exactly the right way including sport peppers and celery salt.  The Italian beef is scratch made and as good as the best Al's in Chicago.  If I had one minor point it would be the fries. They're good even have seasoning salt but they are frozen instead of fresh cut. Dont worry I still ate them.  If your craving a taste of back home, stop in for a bite. Get the number 4, a dog and a 1/2 beef sandwhich. You'll be hlaf you did

K-fZ8KXLonua6Jn966ORKg.text: Come here all the time food is amazing the dipped beef's are on point. Love the fries Service is great definitely what you would expect from a Chicago eatery lol I will definitely continue to come here

2cBF7uy4NfOgpGy6qep_0w.text: Our family has been here a few times and the service and food is always outstanding! The nice ladies (& gents) at the counter always greets us with genuine smiles and our little guy has never come out of there without them offering a little cup of sherbet (on the house!) Seriously warms my heart!  Everything we have ever ordered from Windy City has been delicious and freshly made! Hotdogs, yum. Wings, better than the other guys. French fries, yes please. Pizza Puff, mmmmm!  But NOTHING can compare or even stand a chance against their ITALIAN BEEF SANDWICH! (with everything; don't you dare take anything off of it.) (WET; they dip the entire sandwich in au jus and you can get it as wet as your heart desires.) You CANNOT order this sandwich without having them dip it into the au jus. I would think that would be somewhat illegal somewhere. There is some sort of 'relish' that they slap on there that has carrots, peppers, onions that will literally knock your socks off. That relish with the thinly sliced juicy roast beef, gooey cheese, and the savory wetness from the au jus will do a number on your tastebuds. Trust me. My mouth is literally salivating as I type this. If you've never tried it, I judge you. Hard.   Go there. Order it. Then thank me later. Kbye.

XneOk9tnz8_cUGWETGU5cg.text: Everything was perfect for this hole in the wall. The food is absolutely perfect for a dipped sandwich I will be back and order the whole menu. The fries were cooked to perfection. My cheat days will now belong to this perfect place to eat.

vsHDELK_nHejvE2B28rmOQ.text: So this place has been on my bookmark list for quite sometime now and I actually had to plan my visit here considering I live on the opposite side of town. I was around the Summerlin area and said why not pay Windy City a visit. So I've been to Chicago and tried the Italian Beef at Portillo's, which was probably the best thing I ate there. The inside of this place is very mom and pop-ish, surprisingly they didn't have much bears or clubs memorabilia, it appears they are more oriented towards the blackhawks and bulls. Anyway onto the food I ordered the Italian beef sandwich combo, came out to $9 and some change (not bad). I ordered mine to be wet, because I felt like the dipped would be too drippy. The beef was pretty good for the most part, but the bread did not adsorb the liquid very well. I was honestly expecting this to taste a lot like Portillo's and unfortunately it did not. The bread really ruined the sandwich because it became really soggy. No, I did not wait to eat my sandwich it was already soggy by the time I got it. My friend who is from Chicago said the same thing, it's definitely a bread issue. He said they should have bread flown in from Chicago and that would do the trick, but realistically speaking that won't happen. I would suggest using Great Bun's French bread, but I don't know if that would be authentic Chicago style? But obviously the hoagie they are using now is not working. Next time I will order the Pizza Puff, since I've never had those before and the combo meal for that is only $4.50. Or maybe even the hotdogs considering that's part of their name sake.

-6QWUHCbspFGZ4qQdXkFCg.text: Born & Raised In Chicago!! How Dare You Name Your Restaurant Windy City Beefs & Dogs!! I'm Sorry This Is The Worst Beef I've Ever Had Nothing Like Johnnies, Portillos, Jays, Gene & Judes That's Original Chicago Beefs This Isn't A Good Knock Off Beef Theirs No place Like Chicago Beefs When I'm Out Of Town I Eat Out At A lot Of Supposedly Chicago Restaurants And Nothing Is Authentic You Must Of Been From Suburbs Not Chicago Please People Don't Think That This Is How Our Food In Chicago Taste Because Its Not!!  Hey Owner CHANGE YOUR NAME!

wK0oLsTKLKncZj-0STWYCg.text: Went for lunch and as always we were greeted by the staff. Very nice.   Had the footlong chili-cheese-onion dog on a wonderfully soft bun. Pretty solid chili dog, not over powering nor too bland. Good middle of road chili. Dogs were fresh and cooked through.  Cheese felt freshly grated and onions had some bite.   Also, ordered the Italian beef with mozzarella, sweet peppers and mild giardiniera served "wet".  First off this sandwich was huge. There's no skimping on ingredients here. Lot's of meat, peppers and cheese.  Being from SoCal this was my first experience with this Chicago icon.  The one thing I would do differently is order it "dry" with the au jus on the side.  Not really down with "wet" sandwiches. I can now cross this off my to-eat list.   Additional I'd like to point out they were very accommodating with one on my kids special request, two plain dogs, just grilled. Also, one of the staff gave a scoop of sherbet on the house after our meal.   Little things like being greeted by a business that is genuinely glad you see you to a free scoop of ice cream add up to a very enjoyable experience. In the words of Arnold "We'll be back".

c-aLBQ0IU14XaGj9FW6UNQ.text: Chicago italian beef with sweet is the only way to go! Best I've had outside the Loop. Good value, friendly staff, and clean.  Can't wait to go back and try the Chicago Dogs.

3lYs2okQfzFlnn1sZGXuCQ.text: First time trying it out! It takes some time, so dont go here if you're in a hurry, fair warning. Had the Chicago dog combo, and it was very good. Dog was just a little snappy, sport peppers spiced it up perfectly, and the relish was that neon green stuff. French fries were more crunchy than I like personally, but delicious little shoestring fries. I really like the fact that nothing was TOO salty... I know what's important to many people. I will definitely go back and take the hubby and try out some of the other stuff!

JK2UDUqa7AY2wj6DzNLHjw.text: I usually eat at their other location near my house in Henderson which also serves Pizza, but this location is just as good, and 95% on the authenticity scale    Gonella brand Italian bread is what most places in Chicago use but it's impossible to find in the west and cost prohibitive to ship. There probably is another brand of bread that's available around here that's more like Gonella which would boost the authenticity rating up a notch or two, but with all of my nit-picking aside Windy City is a great choice, and in my opinion even better and more authentic than both Rossatis's (pizza pub) and Al's (which is supposedly a Chicago tradition and recently closed up after 2 years of business in Las Vegas)

e722d-T8zTiDy3eVekHPUA.text: This is my favorite dive restaurant  in all of Las Vegas.  The food is made fresh and cooked to order.  The business is family owned and ran and the folks are all very friendly.    My favorite is the Ruben Sandwich.  It is made with fresh mozzarella cheese, suaerkraut, thousand island dressing, and pastrami piled high on grilled marbled rye bread, served with an order of fresh cooked french fries.    You can't beat their Chicken Wing Tuesdays.  Each wing is 50 cents and deep fried to order.  They cook the wings until they are crispy outside and juicy inside and can be tossed with your choice of mild, medium, or hot wing sauce.  They use Vienna brand hot dogs and buns which are delicious (and don't give me the usual hot dog indigestion!)    Windy City also makes their own giardiniera with different levels of spiciness and is to die for!    Don't forget to try their Wunderbars!  Frozen, chocolate dipped cheesecake on a stick!   All in all the food is fantastic, the price is right, and the people are friendly!  I absolutely love this place.

aIORXlygH9wTz53TIqa4ng.text: Best Chicago dogs outside of Chicago.  Being from Chicago,  I know what good Chicago dogs taste like.  This the real deal.  Can't go wong here.  Loved it

abzDHobfWYdxTxSeuj5WCg.text: So I've been trying to be more spontaneous and try new things randomly, which led me to this hidden gem. This place is in the vine parking lot on lake mead and buffalo next to the subway. I honestly wish they had a bigger sign so they could attract more attention.   Anyway, I ordered the Vienna corned beef Reuben sandwich with fries, and it's by far my favorite Reuben I've had in Vegas. XXO4rnnKM8Z9Pg6PHKFihQ.text: My husband and I usually get take-out on Friday nights and Windy City kept popping up on my Yelp app. We decided to give it a try and it's now in our permanent rotation! It's a cute little hole in the wall celebrating all things Chicago. The walls are covered in memorabilia and everyone behind the counter is dressed in Chicago garb. The first time I visited I came in and placed our order and sat at the counter and waited for the food. They were quick, efficient, and super friendly. They used my name and asked me how I was doing. Everything smelled fantastic and I couldn't wait to get home and dig in!   My husband got the #4 - a Chicago style dog and a 3 inch Italian beef with fries. This is definitely a great deal, you get the best of both worlds. I settled on an Italian beef, dipped with mozzarella, and a side of fries. OMG! I fell in love with Italian beef sandwiches in Chicago and this one hit the spot for me. You definitely want it dipped with ooey gooey mozzarella. The sandwich is huge and delicious, I completed gorged myself, leaving only one bite. The fries are shoestring and completely satisfying. Great customer service and delicious food, we were immediately in love. The next time we ordered, we decided to try their chicken wings. My husband love wings and I can appreciate a good wing as well. These are the best! We now split an order (there are 13 in an order, plus fries) and are completely happy. The wings are crispy and huge. The sauce comes on the side, which isn't my favorite, but I don't mind too much because they have so much flavor anyway. Last time we ordered we also tried a pizza puff, basically a step above a hot pocket, but lots of flavor.   No need to get on a place to satiate those Chicago craving, just hop in your car and give them a try!

SpPLj33Gjo-Zdnz4fDZvSg.text: I have only been to this place once, and I can assure you once is enough to get you hooked. I will be back many many times. I am from the Midwest (Wisconsin to be precise) and have visited Chicago a few times. I have had a few good Italian Beef sandwiches in my time and I'm impressed with this place. Not only are the prices reasonable, and the portion sizes are great. I got an Italian Beef sandwich with mozzarella for $8.oo and was completely NOT prepared for the amount of sandwich I was about to get. It gave me two meals. Two delicious meals. Their hot dogs are ACTUAL hot dogs, void of that crazy thing called ketchup.  The service is great and fast. I ordered and only had to wait for a minute or two before my food was served to me. The staff was also very friendly and knew what they were doing. The place also has some crazy specials that go on. Seemingly random things, like "If your name is Nancy, you get a free drink!" Which I mean, is awesome if your name is Nancy, lol. They keep calenders around to in case you want to pick up one. I have found an Italian beef place and look forward to going back. I highly suggest it if you want a lot of food for the money you spend. They also have a sister store down in Henderson called Windy City Beefs-N-Pizzas, which I'm going to check out soon. :)

7mY_5s-bWGzPcB7MCNiFJg.text: Omg...so good. Third time here. Today I got a gyro. Yesterday I got wings and loved them!!! My coworker got them today. On top of fabulous food, the nicest people! Like Cheers but food.

ft--ET8vPwJ1nuWVn8DUSQ.text: If you are anywhere near Windy City you owe it to yourself to stop in for lunch.  Incredible sandwiches, fast, attentive, friendly service, and surprisingly delicious old-school skinny fries! If you're a Chicagoan be sure to mark your home neighborhood on the board, and as always, remember to tip your server.  GREAT place!

xTO6p15PxL9oCFjwkwG0cA.text: My coworker said "let's have Italian beef sandwich today". When asked what he would like for lunch. I'm like hell yea! So off we go!  If you've had one while in Chicago you know these are close in taste to the ones in Chicago but not as good. Maybe it's just me or my excitement of being back to my old stomping grounds. If you are in the Chicago area hit up Portillos. My sandwich came with cheese, giardiniera and some sport peppers on the side. The giardiniera was delicious and a perfect complement to the sandwich. It adds a nice kick (don't worry it's not to spicy) and crunch. I'd say on a level of 1-5 I'd say a 3 or 2.5 in spiciness. You can have it dry, wet or dipped. Dipped is to messy for my. I asked for wet and i almost thought it was dipped. Sandwich was falling apart on me. So I had to pull out the utensils (that made me sound sophisticated!). I made it a combo. That adds fries and a soft drink or how my family says in the Chicago "pop".  The fries come in a brown paper bag. I first I was like "that's it?!" But at the end I couldn't finish my meal. There is another one near my home. It's at Eastern and Silverado Ranch. If you want to try something new and delicious don't hesitate to get a taste of Chicago!

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Always taking a bite before the picture!!!

ZRCIh4nd9sJ1hEFqY2dM1Q.text: Overpriced with small portions. Paid $4.50 for a pretzel with cheese and the thing was probably 4 inches across and tasted microwaved.  Paid $12 for a meal with a hotdog, steak sandwich thing, drinks and fries. Fries were good, hotdog tasted like it had been sitting in warm water for a couple of hours, sandwich was warm at best and the "steak" was bland.

hKQru0Dn3Cp1ubgYYFwMkQ.text: One word: YUM. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on this menu from the looks of it! I forgot what the name of my order was, but it had Italian beef AND Italian sausage. The Italian sausage was to die for. So tasty. They give you the option on if you want your sandwich dipped, wet, swimming, etc depending on how juicy you'd like it.  It was a huge sandwich by the way. I took half of it home for leftovers and I still didn't finish it!  The staff was very nice, the food came out quick for how busy it was, and it was an overall great place to hang out and watch the baseball game while getting some good food! It looked like they also have a unique deal every day so that was pretty cool too!

iUjRwJ18jZaQ8XadvKQTdA.text: My husband and I came here on a whim because we were starving and this location is super close to where we live. I ordered the Chicago style dog with fries, and my husband ordered the chili dog with fries, and we took the food to go. After placing our order, we received our food pretty fast and the employees here were super friendly! That was a nice experience.  I haven't had a Chicago style hot dog since I was in Chicago about 3 years ago. I'm so happy to say that when I tried it here, it tasted almost just as good as I remembered back in the Windy City! The quality of the sausage is so good and all the toppings go so well with each other. My husband LOVED the chili dog. I tried his as well, and I will definitely be getting that next time we come here. The fries taste good as well. Since we brought the food home, I added a little garlic salt to my fries and it transformed them!  I definitely recommend coming here for hot dogs and fries! They do have other items on the menu as well, so also give those a try! I will be

WWPhgsKMoQgzkyiXuEQzIw.text: I'm a Chicagoan no matter where I live. So when a eating establishment takes on the name of the city I was born and raised in. I take it seriously and personally. Now the best was to describe this place is first the moment you walk in it feels and smells like a Chicago beef n dogs place Should smell. The intoxicating smell of grilled onions, mustard mixed in with aroma of French fries, pickles and relish. I ordered the Maxwell st. Polish. With a side of fries. Polish was perfect poppy seed bun. Sweet relish hot peppers and the tangy mustard. The staff is very friendly and inviting. Food is great. This place is sort like a Chicago Embassy in Las Vegas. For my fellow transplants this is a place that's truly Chicago where you can sit and watch a Cubs game while you're eating a Chicago style Italian beef  Hot Dog and a Maxwell st Polish.

4UKnCTMpXL_KAdjp0OY09Q.text: Full stars for this place. This is as good or better than anything I've had in Chicago and it's local to my new home. After living in Seattle my whole life and having limited food options beyond seafood and teriyaki, it's really nice to have a little bit of everything here. these guys are friendly and the service is fast. The Italian Beef and Chicago Dogs are outstanding. I only wish it was a little closer to my house but honestly, it's a lot closer than anything like this was in WA. Totally great find!

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1-ll-pLSDSFZO37uCQ3zsA.text: First time in. Won't be the last. Very small place. Long and thin. Limited menu but enough on there for everyone as long as you like meat!  I had Chicago style hotdog and the Italian sausage on a Chicago roll with peppers and onions and I added mustard. Hot dog was on a sesame seed bun with all the accoutrements. Hot pepper check. Pickle. Check. Onions.   Check. The dog was nice and snappy and the bun fresh. The hot dogs are steamed or boiled not grilled. The sausage was spicy. (I got the hot.) and the bun was good. Really good meal with a side of fries and washed it all down with a Fanta grape. People were super nice and it didn't take long to get our food on a busy lunch time Friday.

ur6J-3UzS3l38G2sB0uyCg.text: I have to say, I wasn't expecting a Chicago dog place to be so authentic in the middle of Las Vegas.  Not even on the strip, but out towards Summerlin.  But, yeah, this was spot on!  Full disclosure: I'm not from Chicago.  I've been there, I've had Chicago dogs and Chicago beef sandwiches from there, but I'm not what you would call a local.  That being said, the dog and beef at Windy City were as authentic as any I'd had in Chi-town.  #FightMe  I liked the diner-style atmosphere and I ate at the counter.  The beef was completely dipped, which meant messy as all git-out, but that's just what I wanted.  It was so tasty, too... very full of beefy flavor, but with a nice savory, herby note to it.  The mild giardiniera was the perfect compliment.   I had the combo with the dog, so I got to try a bit of both worlds.  Not only did they have all the right toppings, but they even included the celery salt.  And the poppy seed bun!  Nice touch.  The fries were freshly made and served nice and hot.  Well seasoned, too.  Yeah, they came from the freezer, but they were good freezer fries.  I had a tamale, too, but that was mainly to try the chili, which was nice and hearty.  The tamale was definitely an Americanized version, but it was filling.  The staff was really friendly, despite the fact that I was there about a half hour from closing.  They genuinely seemed to enjoy their jobs, which is always a great thing to see.  They made me feel welcomed.    Overall, a great find and a wonderful experience.  Thank you for a fantastic meal and a quick trip to the Windy City!

ZnQilt333dznufU1GtGhzQ.text: Great place to grab some hot dogs and plenty to select from! Prices are great too because they come with a bag o' fries. Yum, yummy!

VdNtC51FSXxgoQ6dD6WVwQ.text: Interesting. I order one item without making it a combo and my total is over $12!   Normally I don't take into consideration the price but it didn't help that the food tasted so bland. Felt like a waste of money. The sandwich literally came with the just the bun, and beef/sausage. Anything else to make it somewhat flavorful you have to pay extra. I asked them for one thing and they still forgot it!  Maybe I tried the wrong item but compared to actual Chicago food, it's no comparison!

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j4cchovYvcv0iEvHczzgPQ.text: We always have perfect food every time we are there. The French fries are always freshly cooked. The staff is very hospitable and always in a good mood. I always get the Italian beef which is perfect and last night i had a bite of my girls friend Rueben and it was equally as good. Keep up the good work!

DySRZt-oKMILSLcfaMoeRA.text: 1st off I'm from Chicago but been in Vegas almost 3 years & the food is AMAZING. It taste just like my city food, i finally found a place to eat that i can call home thank you!

wwFcUEKXJD5M49tpiyk7FA.text: It was great . Good food and service. My husband said he prefers his bread toasted on the sausage dog.  (:

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian beef

x6e-7nzLWxAVnYj0P36gkA.text: Great dogs, fries and sandwiches, dropped a point as they should stress to new comers that the wet sandwiches dont travel the best, by the time you get anywhere they are so soggy its not very good.

9ZtQ1ydkB3KribgtVars2w.text: The food was excellent I little pricey for hotdogs but good.   Fortunately the customer service sucked.   I brought my elderly mother there who doesn't eat or drink very much I wanted to share my soda with her they said it would be another $2.50 for a soda which is ridiculous when my mom would only take a few sips.   I bought one soda and instead of putting any in a small cup for her to use I just let her drink out of my cup.    It's funny when they bitched about sharing a soda but they said nothing about sharing fries.    This is not a company that helps the elderly as far as their policy's.  They should think about that.    Even though the food is good I will not be going back there for that reason.

EXnMeqeLA1SrAidDsysPFQ.text: This place is awesome. Super chill vibes, sports and Chicago memorabilia all over the walls, and the prices are right in my ballpark. About $10 a meal. They also have a great discount calendar you should look at BEFORE you order. They give freebies based on your first name and have discounts for teachers!   The food is great! I'm ashamed to say I've been to this place multiple days in a row because of the food. Burgers, hot dogs, sammiches (yes, sammiches) are all amazing. The kid likes to watch them cook over the counter, and they are always super nice to her as she watches.   I'd recommend this place for sit in or takeout, lunch or dinner. In fact, we may just go back tonight!

vbPLDYxlT8rdGL8k3FlsFw.text: My new place for Italian combo and cheese fries. This place reminds me of being back home in Chicago and enjoying a good sandwich from a couple of other notable places that serve great food. Plus, the service is friendly and courteous.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo w/cheese fries.

Y2eWC55-8E4dXodJuJhAjA.text: I'm from Chicago born and raised and I know True authentic Chicago food! I tried their Italian beef and it wasn't too bad! I think it could've been a little more seasoned but that's it! I also ordered the wings and I must say, I was HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED!!! I understand that you wanna have fast service but my wings were small and over cooked and the mild sauce wasn't bad but it also wasn't authentic Chicago sauce either!

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small over cooked wings

7vcJgQy2Mlk0hMGuZKD59Q.text: Love Windy City. Love Windy City. Love Windy City!! As soon as you walk in, you're transported to Chicago. The memorabilia, the decor, everything. Always greeted with a smile, and the food is spot on. Italian Beef.. YUM The Hot Dogs ...... Perfect, the fries?? Exactly what fries should be.... crispy, greasy, and in a brown paper bag. I love Windy City, My kids love it. In fact, I think we will go today!!

AMijXjyrNzF_o1b94NHVCg.text: Awesome place! I stopped in here right after I shipped out some wine because the only place that can ship wine in Vegas is conveniently located right next door, and I'm glad I did. I ordered the #7 double with fries, and it was amazing. The owners were very friendly as well. They checked on me several times, and made you feel valued.   I'll be paying them another visit.

rMaCKNr68lPfGJmesrpV_w.text: The food here is good. It isn't bad, but I don't think that it is great either. The Polish sausage was pretty good. But, without all the toppings, it is just about as good as the one at Costco. On the other hand, I am not a sausage connoisseur, so you may not want to believe me in that regard.  The best part about eating here was the service for sure. Also, they have really cool specials depending on what your name is daily. I would probably go back here.

8Ueq2riq6oIZe73eZfhIUw.text: I ordered the other night.Great customer service.Good hot dogs.

xGxGoGUPi7-1fWNCNM9EnA.text: First time here and already great first impression. I ordered #8 wings (mango habanero and bbq tossed in) and fries. It was not expensive at all but the food tasted like I was in an expensive place. Great service, the cashier even went outside just to give us salt and pepper. When we left they even said have a great day. Welp, because of them i definitely did. 10/10 would come back.

N0sfRS_dP3cH_78nUqA5oQ.text: Wanted to try hot dogs today, there are several places all over Vegas and this place has had good reviews, so my husband and I stopped in to give them a try.   First, this place is small and the tables are limited and close together, there is a bar that allows you to sit grill side, and some tables outside. You walk all the way in to place your order and since this place was packed, I grabbed us a table and my husband stood in line to order.   The dogs came out quickly, and we dug in, I got the polish sausage and fries. Served on a poppy seed bun and served with grilled onions, and the hottest peppers. The fries were fresh out of the fryer, so they were hot and crisp. This dog was good, each bite was fresh and no soggy bun here!   I'd come back and try again, it's simple, fresh, and fast.

lxGe8dRd_LKOhfce7FuejQ.text: I ordered #16 on the menu 5 minutes before 12:00 noon, the person on the phone asked me when will I be there, I told her in about 10 minutes,  I got there at 12:15, as I walked inside, I saw a long line of people. I asked one of the staff if I need to stand in line. I told him that I ordered my food ahead and picking it up. He rudely said "you have to stand in line". so I did, When I got to the cashier it was already 12:25 and told the cashier, I came to pick up my order. She said with a grin on her face that they have to cook the French fries. I said to her "I thought if you order ahead it will be faster". She said if they cook the French Fries ahead it will be soggy. So I waited some more, finally they called out my name at 12:30. I told one of the staff who handed my food that it doesn't make a difference if I called ahead or not, I still have to wait 15 minutes, more insulting grin from her. I love Chicago Vienna dog but if the service is bad, I am not going back there if I can help it. :(

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mostly older customer I see.

9ozqvxXSf3bOjaegXxvsag.text: Decent food at good prices!  I probably would have hit it with a 3.5 in my book, but it's more of a 4 star spot than a 3 so I will round up.  Ordered the #1, Windy City's Chicago Style Hot Dog & Fries.  Portion was a little small, but I guess that is why they have a #2, which is the same thing but with two dogs lol.  I really liked the pepper and the toppings on the hotdog, but I would be lying if it was my favorite dog in town.  Since I have never had a real Chicago dog, I don't care if it is authentic or not....but the dogs were somewhat small, and not very snappy to me.  But still a solid hotdog!  Also did the #10, Windy City's Chicago Style Italian Beef Sandwich.  We ordered it wet, and it was definitely good, just wished there was something more in there besides meat and bread.  Needs some sort of pepper or veggie for consistency and taste IMO.  My friend ordered the sausage and peppers, and it looked a lot better tasting to me.  I think my tab was around $12, so it is decently priced, and if I ordered the right stuff, it is good bang for your buck.  Give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #1 and #10 Chicago hotdog and Italian Beef Sandwich (wet)!  Great hotdog, just wish there were peppers on the sandwich!

einboz3qKsX0Xgbf3N2Zhg.text: Great place to grab a bite to eat.  I have been here time and time again and have always had a great meal with good service.

P4oIq6mjKc-QVVOVWviGYg.text: This is a great place for a quick bite to eat. The staff is extremely friendly and the food is fantastic. The dogs are truly authentic Chicago dogs! The quality is great and the location was very clean. I highly recommend you check this place out.

pUZfQ_MGqh4oSEGhOYvqAQ.text: Originally from Chicago, I crave the Chicago Vienna dogs at times.   We went across town in search of the Chicago Dog for me, and the Italian Beef for hubby. We were greeted as we walked in the door by two very friendly and outgoing people behind the counter. The Italian Beef was ordered 'wet' (whole sandwich dipped, bread and all) and with the spicy jardiniere.   We took a seat and waited while everything was made fresh. I loved all of the posters and pictures on the wall showing the Chicago stadiums and teams. Made me feel like I was back in Chicago for a bit. Hubby loved the Italian Beef, and made a great mess of himself while eating it. If the juice is running down your arms, you are eating it properly!  This was definitely a fun place to visit, with super friendly staff and great food. I give it 4.5 stars since it seems a bit pricy. Not too badly though. I was torn between 4 and 5 stars.

TYsY6RCv5W8lw5wSD69XPA.text: Can't go wrong with this place.  I have been going to Windy City Beefs N Dogs for many years.  The service has always been friendly and the food always comes out right.  The beefs are, juicy, moist, and lots with flavor.  The prices are fair and I definitely recommend you check this place out.

eSTekWeyckCAFkL37EC_oQ.text: If you want a great Chicago Hot Dog, you'll just have to go to Chicago.  That pretty much sums it up. When in Chicago I make a pilgrimage to Super Dog and Hot Doug's. These two places were rated 3 and 1, respectively in the US.  I had high hopes of finding something, close, not expecting perfection.   At the suggestion of the order person, I ordered the House Special, a hot dog accompanied by a beef dip sandwich.  It was served with  french fries.  Though they did prepare the hot dog with Chicago like fixings, it was nowhere in a class with Super Dog. Neither were the fries, just  on par with Mc Donald's.  I can't say anything nice about the beef dip, so I won't say anything.   I went with Brian, my house painter, who is an exact look a like, for the Zig Zag Man.  He never had a genuine Chicago Hot Dog, but he said he'd had better, too.  Service was friendly, and for Las Vegas, this is better than Pink's, and it's probably as good for a hot dog, that you will find in this wasteland of eateries.   Two Stars means "I've experienced better", and these folks are not in a class with hot dogs from Chicago.

Eyeyhi7VC0BuwmLD5Fqecw.text: You know it's good when you 14 year old boy (born and raised here in Vegas) says he is having a "flavorgasm" The cooks have been here for years and it shows in the quality of the food and service we get here. Thanks again WVB!

ltmmz9GSSLvRxLrqnr5fdg.text: I've had a combo when I was visiting Chicago years back and never could find anything like it until I found this place. Pretty close to what I remember. Sausages are jucy, the beef is on point, and when they dip it in au jus it's like heaven.   The wings are good but can't get over that they don't coat them in the wing sauce and just give it on the side.

qlmkcnWkrGjc-sAa5v9jAg.text: Service and food was excellent. We got beef/sausage combo and Hot dogs and it was just like we were back in Chicago.

0AQ7U6eitQz4u6r7Lu9ZHA.text: Omg! Love this placccce!! I can't even begin to describe! The people there are nice, attentive and genuine. Kind of make you feel like family. It's decor is great and ALWAYS clean.

lP2WgDXbTn-maE5do99Vvg.text: Great place here!! Believe it or not Thames have a great gyro!!! Would never believe it at a hot dog place but it really is good!! And it's tiny inside with a very back east feel!!overall a good spot!!

qAhEZh-oXY0S8tfybowSNg.text: I previously rated this place with five stars, but I'm taking a star away because they have hired a blonde kid several months ago and the service is just not the same. The one thing we noticed that stood out about this place is everyone was *very* friendly and appreciative of their customers.  That has changed... This kid is downright snotty and rude. What a shame.

dsJ1PnhsUvRqPapmMcIubg.text: My family is from Chicago, that's where I was born. I don't remember much about it cause I moved to Vegas when I was 7, but my dad grew up there and remembers it well. He always raves about the food. Since I've had this place bookmarked for a while I thought this would be a great place to get food for him for father's day dinner.   First off we ordered for pickup so I can't comment on the actual dining experience but I can say that the restaurant is small. They have about 10 tables and a small bar that seats about 6. FYI they don't serve alcohol. The walls are all decked out with Chicago shit. Posters and framed newspapers articles, signed memorabilia, etc. I walked in and was greeted by a nice lady who I assume is the owner who told me that they were working on my order and would be ready soon. I sat down and waited about 10 minutes until everything was done. I have to say the owner was very nice she was also really thorough and made sure everything I ordered was in the bags which I appreciate. Hate getting all the way home and realizing something is wrong or worse not in the bag.   When I got home we sat down to eat right away. I immediately noticed the fries were hard and almost cold. I thought they were tasty but would have preferred if they were crispy and hot. I only live about 10 minutes from here so I can't imagine the food went cold in that short amount of time. I think maybe the fries were sitting there while the other food was being prepared.   I ordered the beef sandwich dry with au jus and hot gardinera on the side. My sandwich was exactly how I ordered it.. DRY and not in a good way. The meat was super dry and even dipping it in the au jus didn't help any. The Gardinera tasted homemade but I didn't like it at all. It was missing something and I just can't put my finger on it. I was really disappointed with the sandwich. I would probably order it wet next time if I was to dine in and add cheese and sweet (bell) peppers and hopefully that would make it taste good. We shall see.   I got to sample the reuben which was good but small, a Chicago hot dog that was ok and a polish sausage with hot mustard. The mustard is HOT. I like spicy things but this was really hot it over powered the flavor of the Polish. I might try this place again because I like to support local businesses but I won't go out of my way to go here. I prefer chicago dogs on Rancho wayyyy better then this place.

aCq-WE7K1fAQ-lrlSVjYeg.text: The Chicago style dog was good.  I got it with everything.  But the Italian beef sandwich was to die for.  I got it wet with hot giardiniera and it was so, so good.  I will be back., probably sooner than I should be.

8DkkstXgFRtotM8okYoLwg.text: I was bummed out with my meal. A co-worker recomended the place and I was excited to try my first Chicago dog n Italian beef sandwich. My wife and I waited a couple minutes before anyone appeared to greet us, I guess the employee outside had to finish his cigarette first. Anyway, I ordered the footlong coney on a poppyseed bun w/cheese and an Italian beef sandwich. The coney was smothered in what had to be Hormel can chili(believe me I've had it enough to know) to hide the fact that they used 2 smaller dogs instead of the footlong,sprinkled w/cheese that hangs on the peg at the grocery store instead of shreding their own. I was expecting to eat it like a normal dog but I was denied. Who the hell eats a hotdog w/a knife n fork! The Italian sucked, the beef was sliced so thin it just crumpled into wads. Nothing like their pictures on the wall or what I've seen on tv. Typical decor,tacky Chicago sports memoribilla everywhere,street signs ect... If these city themed eaterie owners love their towns so much,why do they leave them?

_q_HrTJOPybgUFwrSL_09Q.text: Had some great chilli cheese and onions at this place. Terrific. The beef sandwich with peppers was delicious . Overall , my experience was great!

tnNcN7a7h652PHZodftmsg.text: Felt like I was home!  Great pizza puff, True Chicago dog and dunk (gravy) bread.  Staff was really friendly and showed pride in their work.  Not in my neighborhood, but well worth making the drive, will be back for sure!

W05NSOz0b3Hwm2m7hnFTfQ.text: Very friendly staff and yummy food. Best Chicago dog I've had in Vegas for sure.

IvljBai9abQ3hwSVf0A8Uw.text: I have never had a bad anything here and I have been coming here for years! The food is hot and at a good price, Chicago dog with chili cheese fries all the way.

8uNFyo8-HL0mz4RWiYY0ZA.text: Italian beef is a must ! Get it dipped with peppers and cheese ! This place is decked out in all Chicago pictures , sports items

gZNCNP1xHDmQhZgI-ozFrw.text: I had the combo #2 it came with 2 Chicago dogs w/ fries for $6 , the dogs were very good . The dogs had a nice flavor, all beef my favorite. The price is right and service was very friendly and quick.       What more could you want from a hot dog place.

5iilKsLjTMhlO0VN4TsK2w.text: I found out about Windy City Beefs-N-Dogs on Yelp, and decided to take my siblings out to try some of what they had to offer.  We ordered chili dogs and skinny fries.  The lady who helped us was very nice; however, we had to wait quite a while before we got our hot dogs.  (I will say that the place was pretty busy while we were there)  Anyway, once the food came out, we thoroughly enjoyed our delicious meals.  The french fries were crispy and abundant, and the hot dogs had that special "snap" to 'em.  Great little place to check out if you're down for some Chicago-style hot dogs (or chili dogs!).

_C9B4HMlKUQohAGCx25YtA.text: A hard swallow o_O  Hot can't even begin to describe the spicy mustard coated maxwell street style polish. Verbose enough? As of late I've been divulging into spicy meals where ever & whenever feasible & its been rather flat out, well that's just about it, flat (or maybe I haven't been going to the right places)  As I chatted away with the friendly lady over the counter about all things chi (yes I'm from chicago) the busy bodies of the place were preparing what would be, my last spicy treat for...oh let's say the next decade.  After a short wait, my meal slid in, coated with sport peppers, spicy mustard & everything else in the kitchen sink! Slid the peppers out of the way & worked my way into the meal.   A quarter of the way through the heat had started building up, near half point it felt like an atomic orgasm had just erupted in my mouth! My palate was having a seizure, sweat gushed out of their glands & the tears could no longer be held back! It was scorching hot! To the point where my tongue started rejecting the food the moment it made contact! I gazed at the lady as she remarks "you wanted it spicy" & I return the gesture with the look of defeat. As I take a long pause from the meal to let the heat wear out.  All in all I shall return! For more of the pleasurable punishment! Friendly chi-town staff, neighborly & real. Sorry I couldn't say a proper g-bye, I was sucking up the blood o.O (i kid)

E4tpsmYx1jQqvTRRaAOh9g.text: Awesome place for a great hot dog! My boyfriend is from Chicago and loves this place!

sZwaXDa3n-XuI_WDd-eL0g.text: Best hot dogs in town.  Great Italian beef.  Plus they sell Vienna beef products that you can take home and make yourself.

G0M3TvZsL6Sf_j_sora5bg.text: Been here a few times to satisfy my Chicago food cravings. This review is more about their service. I placed a large to-go in the middle of dinner rush on Saturday night, with a special order. They said about 15 min and they didn't let me down. Walked in and the place was packed.  Nothing missing on the order and our special order was on point: Italian Beef over fries w/med giardiniera and mozzarella. Told them they need to add it to the menu. It can be called "The Southside", that's where we're from LOL. Thanks Windy City. BTW the deep dish at the Eastern location is spot on.

photos.caption: Photo of Windy City Beefs N Dogs - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian Beef over fries...that&#39;s love...

_alL7K4BUpCy4rQkPR0eJw.text: Went to this place for lunch (my second visit) and it was delicious. My boyfriend and I recently took a trip to Chicago and we were craving a "Chicago style hotdog" and found this place. I got the #1 with fries and a drink and they make the hotdog look just like the picture. The owners are nice people (family owned place) and greet you as you come and go. They also have a calendar of gimmicky offers through each month like "if you have a 5 in your address you get a free hotdog". It's neat idea. It's a little pricey for a hotdog combo running about $7.50. I will say though, it tasted just like a chi-town hotdog with the poppy seeds on the bun and everything!

oePYg2mospnry3LgurEnFQ.text: Always a fantastic experience here at WCBND. If you're from Chicago and have a taste of home, this is the place to go (or their other location on the south end of town). Always come here for lunch when I get the chance. Awesome decor as well.

vb8yEdiJsDupyHKbtAy-nw.text: Came here for dinner and ordered the beef and sausage dog, it was really good. We got hotdogs for the kids and they loved them as well. This will be my place for hotdogs in Vegas from now on.

S-T3u59nbiLOu8olrYDe-g.text: I came to Windy City Beef-n-Dogs on a whim when several other attempts at deciding where to go for dinner failed. I am glad I ended up here.  When I first walked in I noticed not only the many other diners but also the Chicago sports memorabilia on the walls.   I spent several minutes looking at the menu of Chicago themed food choices. I settled on the Italian Beef sangwich dipped. That is to say beef on a roll dipped in sauce. Or "gravy" if you want to be correct. It was a huge sandwich and very tasty indeed.  To top off this Chicago outting in Vegas I ordered a Green River Soda. I'm not really sure what to think of Green River. It was almost soap like in taste. I don't think I would order it again. The sandwich I would for sure. Maybe even something different like a classic Chicago Dog. Oh, and the service was good too. A little slow and seemingly unorganized to a small extent. But it was friendly and professional.

liDPoq2IYbLzSBhTPXU2-g.text: This spot has great chicago food, no more, no less.  Now I am not from chicago but I have been there and stuffed my face with all different types of chicago food.  I am not going to get into exactly what makes a great chicago dog, that is another show, all I will say is that if you don't know it is one of this countries great culinary achievements and they follow the formula to a T.  Their italian beefs are real good too, tasty and tender but I typically get the 2 chicago dog meal that comes with some great fresh cooked delicious fries for like 6 bucks.  Their chili dog is solid too but the chicago dog is better for me.    This atmosphere is great, the only thing that reminds you that you are not in some staple chicago spot that has been around for 30 years is how new and clean the place is, with any luck in a few years it will get more dingy.  I always sit at the counter and bug the cooks who are always friendly.  This place is truly a gem.

_GWz1IyLExNX-xXXX7bCGw.text: I had the basic hotdog (I think it's the #1), with various condiments and was unfortunately a bit disappointed.  I was looking forward to finding out what the big deal was about a Vienna hotdog, apparently made famous in Chicago.  Frankly, I couldn't see what all the hype was about.  At $4.50, I thought it was way pricey for what it was.  Not a bad dog, just nothing thrilling.  The dog didn't have much flavor or snap at all.  Buried under a lot of condiments it could have been any type of dog at all, no different or better than the average dog out there.  The bun was somewhat a cut above typical fast food, it had poppy seeds and was okay, but nothing particularly special.     It came with fries, which were good, although a tad salty, but still good with a somewhat different, fuller flavor than  fries I've had elsewhere..  I liked the cute little brown bag they are served in and they never got limp so that's a plus.  But getting back to the hotdog....I liked the neon green relish the best lol....but I didn't go for the relish, I went for the dog.  At $4.50 I won't be trying it again.  I don't know what I was expecting but it didn't send me to the moon or anything.  Darn!  Oh well, maybe other people have a different opinion and to each their own.  But the place is clean, looks well run and I guess is popular for certain sandwiches which run upwards of $6-8 which again is too much for me unless it's amazingly outstanding.   Judging from the hotdog which for me was "meh", I'd have to be seriously convinced to make another stop in here.

Q3HQOHGzfMHXiLMcM8HQeA.text: The BF and i had a hot dog and a Spicy sausage and beef sandwich. That giardiniera was good! It was unfortunate that a whole bite of the sandwich was wasted because the prongs of the fork broke off. But, the food was soo good, and staff was friendly. Previous experiences were good also. Last time, i had the gyro and that was amazing! The tzatziki sauce is made in-house!!! We love this place.

DN_969rRcaI5T9gkxxOMWQ.text: On a whim, I stopped in and was treated to a fantastic dog and friendly service. I greedily eyed the beef sandwiches while I ate, so I'll definitely have to come back for one of those.

qSA6xurjBt-SaeUYE_BV6A.text: Oh Yeah, this place is the real deal with deez guys alright. Chicago style dogs, beefs, combos, pizza puffs etc.  I know cus I worked at an authentic Chicago Hot Dog & Beef joint for over 10 yrs. in the burbs of Chicago.  It's as simple as that. And exactly like that.

z1yUoXuTEIMb4HjbhxSw_w.text: Got to eat here this past weekend. First time dining in as we only did to go once before. We had an appointment across the street and wanted to eat at someplace in the area. We were also hungry and wanted a quick bite to eat.. This is a great place to come if you're hungry and want food asap!   We ordered two corn dogs, a #4- best of both worlds hot dog and 3in beef sandwich, #8 -chicken wings (mild with ranch) & their special for that day - a 16in sausage with fries and a drink.  Everything was pretty good! The fries were not soggy, nor burnt. The chicken wings aren't smothered in sauce, which is appreciated. It gives you the chance to put as much or as little as you want. It's even enjoyed by the little ones because it's not spicy.   We went around 3:30pm and dined in. There were only 2 other parties eating there. However, while we were there, 4 other people came in and did to go orders.

BScVkZ2bv69O9dJ3sZW2Vg.text: YUMMY YUMMY YUMMY I left Chicago in 1999 and always had to go back to Chitown to satisfy my hot dog craving.  Now I only have to drive 10 minutes from my house and stuff my face.  Their hot dog is perfect representation of a True Chicago Hot Dog.  This joint is gonna see a whole lot of me.   Jeni :)

qc5kgLYe8t4u6Q5y_E6Neg.text: I ordered the dipped Italian beef sando with mozarella and jardiniere (medium spicy).  When I looked at the menu, I wondered why this one didn't come with fries like many of the other items here.  That was until I saw it.  This thing is GIGANTIC!  It is dripping wet.  It is messy.  It is really tasty.    I can only compare this to the one I tried at Al's Italian Beef when that was still open.  I think the jardiniere and seasoning were a little better at Al's, but this is still quite good.  You do have to pay extra for both cheese and jardiniere, but both are well worth it.  I'll try it with sweet peppers next time.    Well worth a visit and the food coma that follows.

Zh9fNkaIsvAcs3ls4vmuqQ.text: This is the REAL Deal!! Until Windy City came you could never get a REAL Italian Beef Sandwich. I Would visit Chicago for 7 days and have over 20 sandwiches!!  Now I visit Windy City WEEKLY!! I have brought many people here, Chicagoans LOVE the place, non-Chicago people may not know any better, but they STILL love the place.  If you are from Chicago RUN do not walk to Windy City Dogs. It is truly a taste of home!!!

wX3zMBXkIgxxZiPpDEz00g.text: Wow!! A taste of Chicago in Las Vegas, awesome food beef, Chicago dogs, Italian beef, pizza puff n fries :) Great flavor in a family owned business.   They have a chicago themed diner.

Gh4g6RYllAKcDDEaLfzFNA.text: Me and my boyfriend are so excited we found this place! We were so disappointed when hot dog heaven shut down. We literally have tried so many places claiming they have great "Italian beefs" with no success. Today I was super stuffed up and feeling like crud and told my boyfriend all I want is an Italian beef with hot peppers. Welp Windy City didn't fail us. I'm cleared up and hot damn was it soo delicious. We will for sure be back!

R1aov8PqGrPYbh6lun35Cw.text: Located in the Von's shopping center on Lake Mead & Buffalo, Windy City Beefs-n-Dogs is run by "dees guys" who believe Chicago food is the best in the world. And in an effort to bring some of that flavor to Vegas, they've got a full menu of classic dishes straight from their hometown.  Now, the restaurant itself is a bit on the small side. When you walk in the door, it's basically like looking down a hallway with chairs against the wall. There's also counter style seating to the right that overlooks the cooks working their magic, and a menu hanging over the register where you place your orders. On that menu, you'll not only find those classic Chicago dishes, but other options like burgers, wings, fingers and even gyros. Unlike their Eastern location though, this one does not serve pizza. However, they've just added a new bulk menu that allows you take home everything from pounds of meat, to gallons of ju!    On the just under a handful of times that we've been here, these are the things I've had...  Chicago Dog - A classic, done right! No matter where I go, this is absolutely one of my favorite ways to eat a hot dog, and dees guys now how to do it. They proudly display their use of Vienna beef dogs and top it with all fresh ingredients, including a full pickle spear, the all important tomato wedges and of course, snappy and spicy sport peppers. Plus they put in all a perfectly steamed poppyseed bun, making for one of the better Chicago dogs you'll find in town.  Beef Sandwich - Easily one of, if not the best I've had in Vegas! Tons of thinly sliced tender beef and mozzarella cheese inside, and done up with gravy however you like. I prefer mine wet, giving it a good balance of texture without making it too soggy where it requires a fork & knife. I'm also a huge fan of their spicy Papa's Giardiniera, which gets its heat from habanero and serrano peppers tossed in with diced veggies. If you like a good beef sandwich, this is where to find it!  Pizza Puff - This is definitely my least favorite thing I've tried here. They describe it as a folded up piece of pizza that's deep fried, almost like a glorified hot pocket. While it's okay, I feel like the taste of this could be much improved with higher quality ingredient. But for only a few bucks and served with fries, it's worth ordering just to give it a shot for yourself.   We've also tried a few different items, such as fingers, wings and fries. I wasn't a huge fan of either the wings or fingers, they just have very little to offer, but the fresh cut fries are decent and come plentiful in a brown paper baggy. That's sure to make just about any fry lover smile!  Prices aren't terrible either and I love the way they do mix and match things on the menu. My order is almost always the #4 which comes with both a Chicago dog and smaller 3" beef sandwich. You get the best of both worlds, and for only about $9, it's more than worth it.  Lastly, this place has excellent service. We've been greeted with smiles every single time, and there's always regulars in that they recognize, giving it in a nice small town feel.   Having never been to Chicago myself, I can't say for sure if this stuff is authentic...but I can tell you that it's excellent! And if this is how they do it in Chicago, book me a flight and get those dogs and beef sandwiches going!

KwzZQQ5QoMWOmqXSeK-koQ.text: Experience:  I was in between appts in the area, so I thought I'd try something new....looked on YELP and this had great reviews, so here I am!!  Facility:  Small joint with about 10 tables and 10 counter seats. Very clean, quaint fast food style with lots of sports memorabilia on the walls to keep your eyes entertained.   Service:  I approached the lady at the counter who identified herself as Lindsay, and after finding out it was my first time, she immediately went into the description of what they offer and what is popular. She was so friendly and helpful!!!  You can tell she is someone who actually enjoys her job...management give her a raise!  ;)  Food:  together we decided on the #4, which had a Chicago style hot dog and a beef half sandwich, their two most popular choices.  The Chicago style dog was loaded with toppings and delicious. I ordered mine with no onions.   Then the beef sandwich was served "wet", which means they dip in it au jus for you. I got this with cheese and Papa's Giardinera hot pepper mix on top. Loved the sandwich and the peppers were just the perfect amount of spicy.  The French fries were some of the best I've had in a long time. They were hot, freshly cooked shoestring fries with a mild seasoning salt. Just amazing! Then to really put my experience over the top, they have a calendar with unique specials everyday.  Guess what today's was??  A free hot dog for anyone whose name begins with "L". Score!!!!  So, I got that one plain and Togo for later.   Overall:  just loved this little spot. Although I don't like to give a lot of 5 stars out to fast food...between the service, fries, and the free hot dog, how could I jot?!?! It is kinda outta the way, but since I have appts on this side of town, I will be back again to try something new. You gotta try this spot too!!!!
